Front cam works great with impressive video, rear is quite suitable for video chat.

Reviews.Title: Handy Dandy Tablet
Reviews.Author: Trish Brown
Reviews.Content: I am still learning how to maximize my usage of the android os, but so far I could not be more pleased.

Reviews.Title: Best for the money!
Reviews.Author: Erinda Kanina
Reviews.Content: Best for the money! Very happy with my choice. It is fast, colorfull display and batery lasts 9 hours average.

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet I have ever scene or used bar none.
Reviews.Author: Christopher Davidson
Reviews.Content: This tablet is amazing.  Smooth and fast interface.  INCREDIBLE picture, very sharp and vivid.  This is our 4th ASUS product.  Couldn't be more pleased.  ASUS has outdone themselves again.  2G of RAM makes for awesome performance of all apps.  INTEL processor is impressive.  No issues thus far regarding ARM specific apps. STRONGLY recommend.

Reviews.Title: Ipad killer
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This tablet rocks.  The display is one of the best out there.  I think it has a good weight to it and is a great design.  It is very fast, more so than the more expensive tablets out there.  The battery life is very impressive.  I love that this is an Android tablet.  All of the apps, games, books, and magazines look and work great.  16 gb is a good amount of memory, but am glad that  I can add more storage whenever needed simply by popping in a microSD.  My only complaint on this tablet is that I only bought one and it is hard to pry the tablet out of my wife's hands.  Haha :-)  Looks like I will be buying a second one in a few weeks.  Well worth the price!  Get one now, you will love it.

Reviews.Title: Great Pad at a supper price!!!
Reviews.Author: J.E. Amiot "Joe"
Reviews.Content: This Asus pad is a wonderful buy and has all the features of the more expensive products out there. Why pay more when the Asus can fit the bill and has good ratings by websites like "cnet.com." So do your homework like we did and buy the best product you need and don't leave any "money on the table" unless you have more than you need. Send some of the money you save to a charity that needs the money much more. A+ product that is easy and convenient to use. We recommend it for yourself or as a gift for someone.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TABLET, it is a great buy.  Awesome quality. A MUST HAVE.  READ MY REVIEW!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet for a few weeks now.  I have had NO ISSUES with it period.  It has literally chewed up and spit out every task I have asked of it.  It is not draggy, it is quick.  It has and AWESOME screen with absolute crystal clear viewing.  It has a good viewing angle too.  I went into a local electronics store and played with the new ipad air.  I truly cannot see any differences that constitutes spending the extra money just for the name.  This tablet has AWESOME sound as well.  It is loud.  It works on wifi, it has bluetooth and it is running on 4.3 android.  Do yourself a favor, if you are reading my review now, that means you are loooking to buy a good tablet, so, stop here and order this ASUS...

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased!
Reviews.Author: Guillermo Herrera
Reviews.Content: This tablet has great sound, great screen responsiveness, and packs great memory and graphics abilities. It also has Androids latest Jelly Bean software version and an intel chip. Unless you want it encased in gold, there is plenty to like. Its easy to use if your an Apple person and offers a memory card slot to expand your data storage with ease. I bought the original ASUS keyboard case for it and it feels just right. Just get a matte screen protector to reduce glare and fingerprints on the screen thats the only thing that bothered me. ASUS got it right on this one! Its a winner!

Reviews.Title: Christmas Gift for my Girlfriend
Reviews.Author: Daniel J Trimble
Reviews.Content: She had been asking for one for about a year and a half now, did a little bit of research and settled on the ASUS Memo FHD 10 and waited for it to arrive. I ordered a little close to christmas so it arrived two days after but she didn't care as soon as she opened the box she lost her mind. Put it on the charger and away she went playing and learning on it the rest of the day.Almost a month later she still loves it and hasn't found a reason not to. Haven't bought any accessories for it yet but plan to in the future.Pros -Great screen, resolution and brightness are just what I was hoping for. Full HD for movies and games, snappy display with an accurate touch interface. I wouldn't want to do surgery with it but its on par with almost every smartphone I've used. Battery life is good even with hard use and it recharges quickly. Have yet to have any memory over run errors with apps and everything downloaded so far from the play store is perfectly compatible. I'm happy, she's happy, I'm happy that she's happy...it was a good choice for a gift.Cons -Only thing so far I don't like is transferring files from my Linux OS to the tablet, kind of a pain but I found a work around (Airdroid). The only other thing that I can think of is the lack of Adobe Flash Player support in the stock browser and chrome, won't likely be an issue in the future as HTML5 continues to gain popularity but for some applications it is a drawback. Solution for that is a browser that still maintains Adobe Flash Player support like Mozilla Firefox and backdooring in Adobe Flash Player, google is your friend.I may end up buying another one because I like using her's so much.

Reviews.Title: Wife Happy
Reviews.Author: Wallace A. Chambers "Wallyworld"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife to download books and to surf the internet.  After initially becoming a little anxious learning to use a new computer variant, she absolutely loves this tablet.  It is similar to using her Razr Android and that helped in quickly learning the Asus Memo Pad.  I purchased a 32 gig high speed micro sd card from Amazon.  She now has over 10k books in her hand, and that took up only a fifth of the micro sd card!  That fact in itself is phenomenal.  She also loves the available apps and it has a long battery life.  This tablet is certainly a BEST BUY.

Reviews.Title: THIS TABLET IS AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: JOE
Reviews.Content: I own asus products already laptops nexus 7 , etc......I was watching the TF700T for a while was received very well but only has one speaker and no built in usb cableI then could not wait for the TF701T to arrive when it did the pricing at one point was great the reviews were so so but from what i have studied throught the years the transformer pads especially infinity do not disappoint.  At first reviews have to understand with new hardware, software, etc... there will always be kinks that need to be ironed out i really loved all the stats expect they lowered the camera pixels and did not update to two speakers for such a high end product so i started carefully studying the memo pads which were anticipated long time ago and were going to be I believe their answer to nexus 10 but anyway the reivews on all memo pads are great sell through amazing. Know back to my baby the ASUS MeMO FHD 10 ME302C-B1 10.1 32gb tablet.The reivews were consistent and the specs were great with the 2gb ram, 1920x1200 resolution micro usb and port TWO SPEAKERS with asus sonicmaster to tweak the sound and there you have one fine tablet at a great price add in asus ownsoftware 1.6 speed like the tf700t and I WAS SOLD.  HAD IT ONLY for only 3 days but have worked on most aspects of it pretty thoroughly to give this kind of evaluation.  I would definately give the TABLET a  5 star rating and recommend it to anyone looking for a solid tablet great specs, screen res, speed, reliability at an amazing price go get one under 300 and you won['t be disappointed.JOE C.

Reviews.Title: Budget tablet performing like a champion
Reviews.Author: Francis Bernard
Reviews.Content: This tablet does exactly what you want it to do.Allows my kids to play their little games and the wife to watch her TV streams and movies.Battery seems to last about 5-7 hours under heavy use and around 48hrs on moderate use.Key to long lasting battery is lowering the screen brightness and not playing "games".Streaming videos the battery lasts longer than the 10hrs advertised.

Reviews.Title: Awseome bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: drEville
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a Christmas present to my less tech savvy parents. Haven't had this for long but the time spent with it shows a strong indication that the purchase choice was an excellent one.Wanted a quick, not necessarily fastest ten inch tablet available today with front and rear cameras, a micro sd slot, newest version of android (Kit Kat not really available yet to the masses nor do I wanna flash since its my parents.), long battery life and a micro hdmi slot if possible or miracast enabled.This tablet had everything I was looking for and more. The Intel chip does well with performance. Things are quick and responsive but I've read that with the Intel chip since not specifically designed for a mobile platform OS, somethings may run slower than expected. Haven't encountered any hiccups but again just recently had got so time will tell. Ymmv.Everything was easy to setup, screen looks great, nice having full hd too. Sound is crystal and vibrant.  Shot a few test vids and sound came out very nicely, parents even commented on it. Pictures look great whether taking pics, vids or looking at others I online. The weight for a ten inch tablet is superb. It's very, very light and I even purchased a procase leather case for it and it's still light, manageable for one hand holding still.The one drawback for me is that the screen isn't the brightest so you may want to consider other tablets if you like to take your tech on the go and use outside frequently. Other than that, nothing else has come up for any drawbacks, and if they do will try and update.Very pleased with this purchase. For the price and features this table has it's hard to pass up for, at the very least, a consideration.

Reviews.Title: ASUS MeMO Pad FHD 10 ME302C-B1-BL 10.1-Inch 32GB Tablet (Blue)
Reviews.Author: G
Reviews.Content: The ASUS MeMO worked great for about two days and then it developed a small green vertical line on the screen.  Amazon was great with the return but were out of them.  We reordered from another vender.  We are very happy with the choice of the ASUS MeMo, and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Dman
Reviews.Content: I'd have to say I'm pretty impressed so far. It seems like a lot of pro reviews about the FHD 10 are  lukewarm and compare it to the Nexus 10 which from what I've seen cost $100 + (33%) more street price than the memo pad but the users reviews I've seen talk pretty favorably about this tablet so I decided to roll the dice. I also own a 2012 Nexus 7 so I have something to compare it to.Back story: 2 weeks before Christmas I went to Staples and bought what I thought was the memo pad fhd 10 on sale but it turned out to be the lower spec ME102. I used it for about a week and it wasn't bad but then I figured out I had the wrong tablet and I found the FHD 10 for only $20 more so I ordered it and returned the ME102 and I'm glad I did because the FHD smokes the it in every way.I'm pretty technical so I did my homework on what was out there in this price range and what attracted me was the screen resolution, 2 gb of ram, the microSD slot, and the HDMI output. I was a little concerned about the processor causing app compatibility problems after reading some of the reviews but so far I haven't run across one app that doesn't install and work. I don't  play games on this so I can't really comment on extreme gaming  performance but I use this tablet pretty heavy for day to day tasks and for what I do it's very responsive and so far much better than my 2012 Nexus 7 which cost me more than the FHD.Some people complained about the build quality seeming flimsy and while the shell doesn't feel as industrial as my Nexus 7 time will tell. I don't beat my toys so I don't see this as a problem but do yourself a favor and buy a nice fitting case for it, they're not easy to find for this specific tablet but they're available online.Sound is very good for small speakersInstalled a 32 gb micro sd card no problemHooked up the hdmi to a tv and it worked great. I don`t normally plug a tablet into my tv but I could see this being handy if the need arises.The graphics are very very nice, crisp and clear. The bigger pictures in the Facebook app take a couple of seconds to appear but my Nexus 7 takes longer.As far as performance its peppy and responsive, quicker than the nexus and the ME102.As far as apps it has a nice assortment of basic Android apps but I wish I could uninstall what I don't want but Asus has them locked in.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this tablet!!!
Reviews.Author: Jodi Artzberger
Reviews.Content: This is perfect and couldn't fit my needs any better! I can do email, Facebook, Angry Birds (lol), Amazon Prime (with Puffin Web Browser, free and Adobe Flash) and of course Kindle. There are tons of apps and games to pick from for free. No hang ups, no crashing, the camera is decent and works well. It's pretty user friendly and doesn't take much to set it up. For the money, it's a great deal!!

Reviews.Title: Alot better than last tablet i had that i had to return..
Reviews.Author: Erica Blohm
Reviews.Content: This tablet runs great. Its fast to download apps and graphics are awesome. Its alot better than the Dragon Touch in my opinion. I had that and its a good tablet I just wasnt fond of the resolution it had. This one is pretty good on that. If you are looking for good sound, resolution, fast, and good memory than this would be great for you or whoever else. Im loving it. It is nice to hold and color blue is nice color for this tablet. Im still playing around with it and using it right now for this review. Im really glad i got it. I recommend this tablet :)

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: RACN33
Reviews.Content: Have been waiting awhile before buying a tablet. Had been leaning toward the ASUS 700, but there were a lot of negative comments, and saw that an upgrade was coming with the ASUS 701.  However this new tablet had worse reviews than the 700.  Then I came across the ASUS MeMo Pad ME302C, and saw that it got the best reviews of all the ASUS tablets.  It has almost all the benefits of the 700, but also includes 2GB of memory, and at a much better price.  Have found it to be very easy to set up, battery life is great, and the display is fantastic. I think this will be a strong competitor to any of the Apple tablets

Reviews.Title: Blown Away!!!!
Reviews.Author: Z28KID
Reviews.Content: After having a ASUS Transformer TF101. I was hesitant about buying ASUS again. The internet was slow on the TF101 compared to other tablets. I was set on getting a Galaxy Tab. I stumbled across this tablet. It had high resolution. 2GB of Ram.  This seemed to be what I wanted. I was on the fence about being disappointed again.  I took the leap.I have to say this ASUS blew me away. They fixed all of the issues on I had the TF101. The internet loads so fast on this tablet. As fast my i7 Laptop. The display is crisp and clear. The movement of the screen is so fluid.  Feels so nice in my hands.All the apps I have tried installed without an issue.If you are on the fence take the dive this tablet is excellent. Very Happy.The only complaint and its not on the tablet is i haven't gotten flash to load even on a side load which i did with the TF101. I know flash isn't supported but it would be nice to watch flash videos.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet with a nice price also
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Nice tablet with a nice price also. The size and weight are controlled well and the 1080p display IS beautiful. x86 processor does not have much compatibility issues, but there are still some exist. Overall it's good enough at a price under 300 dollars.

Reviews.Title: A great buy!
Reviews.Author: Dondra David
Reviews.Content: This was a gift to my mom. It was a great  value for the money. It is user friendly and provided a good introduction for a first  time tablet user. Furthermore, it appearance is elegant a bit of an eye catcher in fact. Best of all its light weight makes it easy for her to  use it as an e-reader when attending religious service as opposed to the Bible and other publications need for these meetings which are quiet heavy.In sum it a great tablet for serious study/reading, play and browsing.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for tablet newbies.
Reviews.Author: Dylan
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my father in law. its the best 10inch Intel tablet for the price. It was easy to use and setup. The large screen size was a big selling point. My father in law also wanted one he could use for google maps. This device only has WiFi but it comes with built in GPS. He has a 3G hotspot he uses while driving around in his RV.

Reviews.Title: Light thin tablet with good features
Reviews.Author: Will Pittenger "Will"
Reviews.Content: Someone finally came out with a tablet that has 32GB of internal storage, 2GB of RAM, and a slot for external storage.  It would be nice if the storage slot had been for a full sized card, but that is minor.  What almost cost this unit a star?  Actually two things.  First, the power button is very sensitive.  I accidentally turned mine on while looking it over.  I meant to charge it first.  This gets worse if you put it in the Folio keyboard case as that holds the power button down causing the unit to think you want it to turn off.Second, I'm having troubles getting my stylus to work with this tablet.  Same stylus works with my older Toshiba Thrive, but not this tablet.  The ASUS person I talked to claimed this was "normal" without explaining it further.Do be aware this tablet is powered by Intel, not ARM.

Reviews.Title: ASUS MeMO Pad FHD 10 ME302C-B1-BL 10.1-Inch 32 GB Tablet Review
Reviews.Author: david
Reviews.Content: The tablet is nice. The screen is a good size. It has been working well/effectively so far from the first couple of weeks since getting it.

Reviews.Title: Memo Pad FHD 10.1 is very good to use
Reviews.Author: Vivekkumar Kanthi
Reviews.Content: Asus Memo Pad FHD 10.1 is very good to use. Really very good tab in a reasonable price. Will sure recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: Great Android Device, powered by Intel
Reviews.Author: Tennis One
Reviews.Content: Very beautifully built machine with a crystal clear and sharp touch screen. Extremely light and easy to hold. Very happy with it.  My favorite thing is the 1920 x 1200 resolution.  Great for watching movies on the go.

Reviews.Title: Asus MeMO Pad
Reviews.Author: S. P. Knight "SPK"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my new Asus pad. It does great for the things that I wanted it for. Like watching Netflix, playing games and just surfing the web. It also came at a great time too. After just having shoulder surgery it was much easier to handle than my laptop and I could still do every thing that I wanted to do.

Reviews.Title: Recent purchase
Reviews.Author: Fhervey
Reviews.Content: This is my first experience with the Android system and with a tablet.  I was very pleased on both counts.  The visuals are bright and clear.  The sound is good.  There was not a manual in the box, but setup was very intuitive.  I believe I made the right choice when making this purchase.

Reviews.Title: The CPU is tragic and ruins this tablet entirely.
Reviews.Author: Clinton Begin
Reviews.Content: I used to be a huge ASUS fan. But for the past 5 years, I have only been disappointed time and again.  I keep swearing that I'll never buy another ASUS products again, but then I'm lured in by a low price or a sale, and then I remember why it's never worth it.The Good:So this tablet has some good things about it.  The screen is absolutely fantastic.  I was very happy with it.  The design and build quality seem to be okay.  The form factor is not as good as Samsung's, but for the $100 price difference, I was willing to accept the massive bezels.  The backing was okay, but not as grippy as I was hoping. Despite what other reviewers say, note that the back is plastic, not rubber.  So despite its dimpled surface, it's still slippery and hard to hold with one hand (a common problem with oblong Android tablets). The sound was impressive for a tablet and the HDMI out is fantastic. I also like that it had a micro SD slot. That's so important and makes Apple look like a bunch of fools for charging $100 for an additional 16GB of storage.The Failure:Unfortunately all of the wonderful things about this tablet come crashing down to a complete failure due to a completely useless CPU.  I bought this tablet for one primary reason: To read PDFs.  My 7" tablet is a little too small for reading rich media PDFs, so I wanted a 10" screen.  I thought: "How can I go wrong with a budget tablet with a 10" screen, just for reading PDFs?"  Well, with ASUS, they always seem to find a way to go wrong.  Adobe Reader struggles with this CPU to open a 4.7MB 32 page PDF that has lots of images.  At first I thought that perhaps this PDF was simply too much for any tablet.  But my 18 month old 7" budget tablet handled it with no problems (other than the screen being too small).So I'll be seeking a new tablet with a different processor.  Clearly between ASUS and Intel, they can't make a tablet that can get even the basics of performance right.  FWIW:  If you own one of these and have this problem, there are a couple of alternative PDF readers that do perform within reason.  I'm personally going to return mine, as I feel no need to suffer the potential future consequences of this broken architecture.Bonus Junk:As with all ASUS products, this thing is loaded with bloatware.  Absolute crap software, and tons of it. I'm used to this after owning a number of ASUS laptops.  But at least with Windows you can permanently uninstall their bloatware (you know, over the course of two hours). But as with all bloatware on Android, you're stuck with this.  The best you can do is force-stop the apps and then disable them... sometimes.  There were a few I could not disable.  And even when you disable them, they still take up precious space in your 16GB of storage.  So plan to get that SD card.  Or root it once your warranty is up.I hate the thought of buying an Apple tablet.  But I might be forced to, given the currently disappointing lineup in the Android space.

Reviews.Title: Charger not working
Reviews.Author: Toddler Mom "CityMom"
Reviews.Content: Just got it and the charger is not working.Not happy about that.  Will check with Amazon about a new charger.

Reviews.Title: Good, but not great tablet.
Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: Pros: lightweight, sleek, and the system is snappy. UI is easy to learn and intuitive - adding and removing widgets is a breeze. Screen is bright and resolution is clear, even with smaller text. Speakers are loud enough and sound quality is on par with any other tablet. Access to sound settings is superb.Cons: slightly flimsy feel to the build, but considering most people use a case/cover, this is irrelevant. Had a few issues with WIFI connectivity - showing a connection to the network but without internet access - which required turning WIFI on/off a few times then finally rebooting the system. This problem seemed to diminish over a day or two. No ability to run flash video, which is a shame, but pretty standard for tablets.Overall: definitely a value for the price, especially if you can find it on sale. The WIFI issue seems pretty common, but does seem to resolve.

Reviews.Title: Best tablet for the money!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: What's not to like?  The tablet is fast light and just right.  I was going to buy an ipad but this one has everything I need and more.  I like the extra storage and the battery life.  Don't wait, pick one up before they are all sold out!!

Reviews.Title: Overall great value..
Reviews.Author: George
Reviews.Content: The product arrived in good working condition. Start up and initial configuration was painless. it has a wide variety of functions that typically cannot be found in this price range. I have used the device for the past 2 weeks and have found no major problems. The video resolution is excellent, and the processor is sufficiently fast.However, to my surprise, ASUS customer service leaves a lot to be desired. I'm having an audio synch problem with a single streaming video app (other streaming apps work fine). I submitted a case on line to ASUS support, received no response, after 5 days I phoned to follow-up. I was required to provide all the same information I had already provided on line, received no resolution or possible fix for the problem, which is still ongoing.Overall great value, good device.. poor support.

Reviews.Title: ASUS MeMo Pad FHD10 is a deal
Reviews.Author: Jiunn "Jiunn"
Reviews.Content: Have been looking for a 10in pad under $300.  I got this at Sam's club for $247, $70 discount till 10/15.  And for this price with 1200x1200 resolution and 16GB. You will feel lucky to have it.  The unit is well built and from the details review from link below, it got a very good scores.My kid and I play Real Racing 3 and Xplane 9 on it. It's awesome.All the good things from other reviewers are true and yes it's Jelly Bean 4.2.[...]

Reviews.Title: Love ASUS
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey
Reviews.Content: I love ASUS and this is my second tablet from them technically. Only thing I dont like is this tablet cannot power external USB devices. Some tablets can. Would be nice if it could.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!
Reviews.Author: K. Morrison
Reviews.Content: I was debating whether to get an iPad or an Android tablet. Other reviews led me to this tablet. The price difference is substantial so I went with this tablet and I'm glad I did. My wife has a 4th gen iPad and there's nothing about that tablet that is better than my ASUS MeMO Pad FHD. I love it, love it, love it.

Reviews.Title: So far, I love it.
Reviews.Author: Patricia Senentz
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of looking before I purchased this.  I am primarily a book reader, but I also do some banking and email checking.  I am exploring all the other things it can do -- for instance it takes lovely pictures.  It was a splurge for me to get this, so I appreciated the reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Just perfect for me
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "RPB"
Reviews.Content: I am using my MeMo pad FHD to read books & news, watch videos and movies & generally "surf" the internet. The ASUS is doing that very well and showing me how fast XFINITY really is.Have 16 GB + 32 GB micro SD and feel the unit is fit for all my needs. Notably better performing in all aspects than my $ 200 more expensive ASUS Transformer that I bought 3 Years ago (and that is giving problems now). So, this is probably the best budget tablet and I prefer it over my wife's I PAD (II). Only down: The sluggish reacting "on" switch needs getting used too. Anyway: Highly recommended for price tag @ US$ 250 or less.

Reviews.Title: Awsome Tablet for the money & performace
Reviews.Author: Puterwzrd
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet. I didn't want to pay an exorbinant amount of money on a device I knew little about to begin with. This tablet is the best bang for the buck hands down. The graphics & sound are phenominal for this type of device with speakers the size they are. I have primarily used it for gaming & internet research. I have watched a few videos on it as well while connected to my Fios internet. Its as good as watching my TV but much more compact. I am still learning about the device & what all it has & how to use those features. However for the price & quality you can NOT go wrong. It has more ram than most all the tablets on the market atm. I know that can change at any time & may have in the time I am writing this review. Knowing how fast these types of things are upgraded. For a high quality upper low budget tablet I wouldstill pick this one over all the rest. I have seen many of the others on the market. Apple's are a bit faster running apps than this one but tons more in price & not worth the price difference for the minute improvement in performance. This has better graphiocs than most with higher resolution & the most standard Ram than most of its era & size. Battery life is average for this type of device. Some say the brightness is lacking in some reviews I have read. But imho its not as lacking as many make it out to be & more than sufficient for my use. Wifi setup is effortless. Linking to sink to TV display with out a cable is a bit tedious but as I stated I am still new with these devices & still learning. For the price & quality I highly recommend this Asus to any & all who are looking for a great tablet with out breaking the bank. There are many that are alot cheaper & many alot pricier but none that match quality for the dollar.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Marnie Hecknauer
Reviews.Content: I researched tablets for a few weeks before deciding on an Android OS and then on this one. Samsung Galaxy Tab and Note seemed to be the big name challengers. I ultimately chose this over the Samsungs because of the HD screen definition. It has a beautiful picture for watching movies on Netflix or from my cloud. All of the Android apps work and look good as well. I didn't buy it for the camera. I tried it to make sure it worked, and it takes decent photos but I have seen better. I would recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: Got it for my mother.
Reviews.Author: natralslction
Reviews.Content: Seems fine so far. It is very user friendly which is good since she has limited tech knowledge. That is all.

Reviews.Title: Good but be careful
Reviews.Author: bridav
Reviews.Content: I ordered this tablet since ATT were offering this tablet for "free" on their website awhile back so I picked it up. Its not bad for the price as the display is bright and speakers are good. My biggest warning I can give anymone who buy this or has one is to buy a male to female micro usb adaptor and keep it plugged into the tablets micro usb part at all times for charging! Overtime (trust me it will happen faster than you think) plugging the usb plug in and than out, the port will bend and you will not be able to generate power to your tablet and since this does not offer a dock than you are SOL with a paperweight. Buy a warranty if you can.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: MD
Reviews.Content: Great price. Timely delivery.  Fantastic resolution.  Easy setup.  Worth what i paid for it.  I would recommend the asus memo 10 to anyone looking for android functionality.

Reviews.Title: Good Except for One Thing
Reviews.Author: Cereal Freak
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a good 10 inch tablet, but didn't want to spend too much. I was looking for one that I could use for the internet, watching movies, email, etc. The display resolution was important to me, and it seems like very few 10 inch tablets have displays better than 1280 x 800 that aren't $400 and above. So this tablet seemed like it would be perfect. And it almost was.My main complaint is that the screen would slightly flicker or "pulse," kind of like what it looks like when an automatic brightness feature is on (which it wasn't). I tried every setting I could think of to fix it, but couldn't (except turning the brightness to 60% and above, which I don't usually do). It was annoying enough to me that I ended up returning the tablet. I didn't end up trying a different one because the price had gone up, so I'll keep searching...

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the money
Reviews.Author: Mark E. Swope "Mark"
Reviews.Content: I was looking at all different tablets out there and with what i planned to use it for just could not justify paying the high price of some of the more popular tablets like the Ipad or Galaxy. So I decided to try the Asus tablet. If you use a tablet for the things that most people do then this one will not disappoint you. It has very good resolution for watching movies or playing games on your apps. The speakers are clear and crisp although having them on the back is in no way ideal. To get the best sound you have to cup your hands while holding it to direct the sound from the speakers to the front. It is slick and smooth between screens and on the web and I have had no issues where the processor is concerned. My friend who owns a Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 7" tablet played around with mine and liked it better than his. I have had no problem with Apps except one or two which are specifically designed to run on the ARM based processing system, but these programs are very specific like XBMC and most people do not use them anyway. If you do you would have to get a custom made version of the app and it still will not run perfectly.But as I stated all of the normally things that people do on a tablet this one will handle with ease. I have not tried any PC type games on it to know how those run, but from demo's I have seen they should be just fine. And with expandable memory you can take it well past those high priced tablets for far less money. If you are looked for a great tablet at a reasonable price that does all the things you want than this just might be the one for you.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet at a great price. Regular Android updates.
Reviews.Author: Dean Walker
Reviews.Content: For the price it is a solid performance tablet. It can get a little slow on graphic intense games, but it copes well and the current user isn't bothered by it. I can imagine some would be fussed by the graphics performance, still, it is hard to beat the price paid for it. Otherwise, it is nice and snappy for someone who surfs the web and checks email.As much as the title says this is blue in colour it is a really dark blue - almost black, don't really care about that though.Asus pushes regular Android updates, and it is currently updated to 4.3 Jelly Bean, will be interesting to see if Asus pushes Kit Kat out to the tablet.Very happy with it and it was cheap to ship to Australia and still be a bargain.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Silent_Bob
Reviews.Content: Responsive screen. Shadowrun Returns runs a little choppy, but definitely playable. Make sure other apps are off if you want to play something. Doesn't run GTA San Andreas, but GTA Vice City runs well enough.

Reviews.Title: A great choice-everything you need
Reviews.Author: eagle2352
Reviews.Content: I think most people that look at the ASUS are comparing it to an iPad but it really it’s apples to oranges. In many ways the tablet moves this genre of technical interface down the field by a mile. You have to keep in mind that a tablet is much closer to a computer,  it’s truly multitasking and only limited by processor and memory.  I purchased this for my wife, who had become disenchanted with the hand me down iPad, not being able to upgrade, and some applications working slow or not at all.  It took all of a minute to find our wifi, and enter the code.  Internet interface is a breeze, 10,000 plus applications to choose from, most if not all the iPad ones were duplicated. Bluetooth connectivity to BOSE speakers, in one step,  file system for storing pictures, text and other, just not as easy on an ipad.  We are still learning the in and outs and little secrets. Like on the Facebook application,  if you see a picture you like, there is an icon that allows you to capture the image and then store in a file on the tablet.  I am sure ipad has this too but the tablet makes it very easy to do.  One of the really major differences is the aspect of having more than one application up and running, so if you use one, the others are  still running and swapping back and forth is effortless. But for 1/3 the cost of iPad and much less than other choices, this is a great deal. We are very pleased. Next go around I will seriously consider tablet before an iPad. Her best friend also bought the same one, a few weels later. I think they will multiply.

Reviews.Title: only negative- doesn't support some apps
Reviews.Author: Tara Lemke
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something that could Skype periodically, take a handful of pictures, browse the internet and act as a calendar/date-planner sort of thing and this tablet does all of that incredibly well. I'm not a gamer at all so I can't give any insight there and I use Facebook, Instagram and Pinterest probably once a week so I do not run a ton of social media apps simultaneously either. I utilize mostly news sites and lots of travel booking sites and am one of those people that employs the 'unlimted' tabs on Chrome and then comes back to read the article or hear the TED talk when I actually have time. That being said, this tablet rarely ever gets bogged down, has excellent battery life, holds up to periodic run-ins with my toddler and is very fast. Nothing exceptionally fancy and the warning in the Google Play Store that 'This app is not compatible with your device' can get a little annoying but it has only been a problem with Amazon Player for Prime Instant Video and ABC's player (which hardly works on anything). It does stream Netflix, History, Discovery, YouTube and Pandora very well though.

Reviews.Title: tablet
Reviews.Author: Lee
Reviews.Content: It couldn't be better. It is all I can do to put it down long enough to charge it. I was going to get an IPad , but I like this better and it was far less expensive.

Reviews.Title: Much better than a Kindle
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The ASUS MeMO Pad is great! It is lighter than the earlier e-pads and has voice function for Google searches.  It is beyond easy to use and can do everything my Kindle Fire did in a larger footprint so that I can actual see the internet searches.  The deal on Amazon.com was fantastic and the delivery very fast.

Reviews.Title: Liking it now
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Lewis
Reviews.Content: I'm really enjoying this tablet. This is my second one because the first that I received had allot of the issues that other reviewers were writing about like it freezing up and having to repower it so often.  So if you are having some issues with yours, then I would ask for a replacement because when right, this really is a good tablet.

Reviews.Title: Comparable to my iPad Mini (except in size)
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have an iPad1, iPad Mini and an Asus Memo Pad FHD 10.  The Asus replaces the iPad1, and is much better.  To be fair, I will not compare an old iPad to a new MeMo Pad because technology has improved for the iPad, which is why I got a new iPad Mini.I some ways, the MeMo (Asus) is better than the Mini (iPad).  I cannot compare weight or size because they are different (apples/oranges0.  However, I can compare other features.Screen resolution:  MeMo is better.  MeMo is higher resolution, and I prefer the wider screen on the Memo.Icons:  MeMo lets me put icons wherever I want.  Mini does that weird iPad thing that forces grouping and shifting in a way that I do not like.USB:  MeMo has a USB port, Mini does not.Charging:  MeMO has micro USB port, so that I can charge with its charger or another USB charger.  I use a portable "New Trent" charger on the go.  Mini requires proprietary charger/connector.  No big deal, but worth mentioning.I have found one negative:  The touch keyboard places the space bar too close to the menu soft button (not a hardware button, but a software button on the face, just below the screen), which makes it too easy to accidentally hit the menu button while typing.  It is not a big deal because I can go right back into the app and continue typing, but it is annoying and weird.

Reviews.Title: Don't charge fast.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It will not charge and when it do it takes a long time to charger battery.work good when you get started.

Reviews.Title: it was a steal!
Reviews.Author: jadedtree
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a tablet for awhile now. Asus has always made great computer parts, so this was the only tablet I was considering. Google's Nexus is made by Asus, so why pay more for the same product. Saw it on Amazon for $242 couldnt pass it up cheapest I'd seen so far. Screen is really sharp and it's fairly fast, really lite weight too. Asus gives you some pretty cool apps for free if you need to use it professionally or for school. First crack at an Android product and I'm impressed. Just wish there was a manual (or tutorials for Android)that came with it. Sure i can google it but would have liked to have something. Camera's not great, pictures look a little fuzzy. Also i don't think there is a flash, or i haven't figured it out yet. Screen is huge so watching Netflix is awesome!  Battery life is ok, not sure where they get the 10 hours from. Not when you're streaming media that's for sure, surfing internet maybe. All in all, for the price it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The display is amazing. Fast, lightweight. Great for iternet surfing, email, etc. I teach online courses and think my laptop will be replaced by this tablet! Highly recommend.Well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: awesome tablet for a great price
Reviews.Author: Raviraj K.
Reviews.Content: I was looking to buy a good tablet for a while and I'm glad I bought this one...Pros:- NOT AN APPLE DEVICE :)- A very bright and sharp display- 2G of RAM- has mini-HDMI port- has expandable memory SD card upto 32GB- has a micro USB interface (so u dont need to buy expensive proprietary cables if u lose them)Cons:- Battery life seems average but not very bad- sd card slot does not have a cover,- camera quality is very BASICoverall a great value for money. Games are very smooth and the overall tablet performance is quite fast. I'm very impressed by this device and is a great value for moneyI was little apprehensive in buying this as some reviews say that some applications may not work on this tab since it has intel processor. Till date I only encountered 1 game that didnt work. But all the apps that are important to me work flawlessly on this tablet.overall I definitely recommend buying this product. great specs for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Twinzdaddy
Reviews.Content: At first, I was a bit reluctant to buy a tablet, with ANDROID running on an Intel processor.  Well, one month later, and I'm happy with my MeMO pad purchase.  This tablet is awesome and runs Google App Store applications right along with my IPad3 Apple Store apps.  Actually, the MeMO pad is better!  I downloaded a free app, that allows me to monitor my kids usage of the tablet, and locks it down when they have exceeded their time.  That same app costs money at the Apple Store.The MeMO pad is lighter that the Ipad3, but with a slightly larger screen.  Games and Apps run great, and the expandable memory offers some great flexibility.  I can run apps from the expandable memory card instead of the table memory.  Apple, you should pay attention.The only downside, is the battery life.  It doesn't last as long as the IPad 3,  however, recharge is very quick.  I've been able to squeeze out 3 movies before it dies.You won't find a better tablet at this price point.  ASUS really did a great job with this one.

Reviews.Title: Absolute Bargain
Reviews.Author: Atara Aberman
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a 10 inch tablet without breaking the bank.Followed loads of user reviews and was pleased I listened to the reviews - having already been used to android using mobile (HTC desire -> samsung note-> s3) getting used to operating the tablet took no time. Setup was dead easy and within an hour all my favorite apps were installed and running perfectly. Packed the tablet with movies and music and it served well for a long haul flight the next day.now (3-4 weeks later) the tablet is being used all over the house and so far - no crashes, no hiccups and the batterly life seems quite fine.In short - no regrets. The Asus (eapecially for the price) is a real winner.

Reviews.Title: Recommend for everybody
Reviews.Author: Serge
Reviews.Content: Yep. My the best devices ever. Nice screen , fast intel processor. I got even more that expected for this money.

Reviews.Title: It is a nice tablet
Reviews.Author: katie
Reviews.Content: It has everything we are looking for, but it shuts down by itself from the first day we got it.  And it doesn't always turn on when you push the power button, you have to keep trying and after 4 or 5 times it will come one.  We have looked in the powering down problem it says it is an app that we installed, but it has all the same apps as our other devices and there is no problem with them.

Reviews.Title: Sometimes Freezes.
Reviews.Author: Lydia
Reviews.Content: Remember when television channels would stop at night and all you would hear was static and see the static on the screen? Well that happens sometimes with this tablet when I start it up cold. I have to hard restart it in order for it to work properly. Other than that this tablet if fantastic for the price.

Reviews.Title: I Love my Asus!!
Reviews.Author: vickie
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet in December, and I love it! The only negative thing I can say is that I have to fight my Grandkids to use it!

Reviews.Title: Gr8 tab for the money...
Reviews.Author: E.D.
Reviews.Content: It's seems to be perfect for needs, the hardware seems solid, great specs...Love the hdmi out, the expandable memory...it's a winner...

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: James T
Reviews.Content: This tablet is great at a cost much less than compatible tablets out there. I like the fact that you can get aps through Google play for little or no cost. This tablet performs great and I would recommend it to anyone that is looking for a tablet that can do pretty much anything that tablets costing twice as much.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!!!
Reviews.Author: Penny Sims
Reviews.Content: Just what I wanted and needed.  Met all my expectations. Have 64g available to me in a tablet without the cost of an I pad.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Teresa L. Roberts
Reviews.Content: I researched and was hoping I picked right, and right i did.  Its the perfect size and the quality of the picture is crystal.  Its easy to learn.

Reviews.Title: First tablet
Reviews.Author: rod fritsche
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet so I have nothing to compare it to. Charged it for 8 hours before use as recommended. I mainly stream video and play a few games. So far this tablet has worked great. The screen is sharp and the colors seem vivid to me. I have not had it freeze up once and streaming video from Netflix has worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Fast tablet
Reviews.Author: Strap77
Reviews.Content: Apps and internet are fast loading.  Screen is very crisp looking and touch responsive  I bought this with a bluetooth keyboard cover and it seems to be almost a laptop alternative.  Enabling bluetooth seems to take battery life down a bit, but not having to hunt and peck on onscreen keyboard is worth the trade off..

Reviews.Title: Excellent choice for the price
Reviews.Author: PM32757
Reviews.Content: For the price you can't go wrong. Excellent product that has a great large screen, very thin and light. Picture is clear and fast speed navigating on the Internet.

Reviews.Title: Asus Memo Pad FHD10
Reviews.Author: Stephen Goggi
Reviews.Content: My Memo Pad works great.  I have used an i Pad before and I find the Memo much easier and more intuitive.  The battery life is also excellent.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: slt a33
Reviews.Content: I've had a ipad for years and love it. When i got this one i wasn't sure if i'd like it, but i love it

Reviews.Title: great value awesome tablet
Reviews.Author: c-bomb
Reviews.Content: i bought this for school for easy portability and note taking. the screen is briliant with videos and hi def games and is powerfull enough for me to play a few race games. it is very light weight and is easy to use. typing is fast and easy if you get the folio case but the case is badly desighed ( i bought the case and wrote a reveiw on that also the case has stress cracks and makes it extreamly diffacult to install and remove the tablet) the battery life is awesome can last me the whole day doing light stuff and standby is increadable about 17 days it said to me. sound quality is awesome too and can get nice and loud with out too much distortion. i was thinking the memo pad or the lenovo yoga 10, im very glad i went with the better display even though the yoga looks more expensive with the aluminum bits. I have been buying and using asus products for a long time and i love my 17 inch asus laptop and my new asus memo pad all except the folio case that could be done better. i woud highly recomend this

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this tablet.  It works great and I haven't had any problems whatsoever.  I did quite a bit of research and decided for the features that I wanted and for the price this tablet was the best value.  It has been great so far.  It has been easy to use and is just as fast as any tablet that I've used in the past.  If you are looking for a great tablet for a great value, I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TABLET!
Reviews.Author: Amazcfa
Reviews.Content: I now have four ASUS products in my household, and they are GREAT!  This tablet is the latest addition, and I love it.  It has IE and Chrome, runs on Android, auto-updates things while I am not using is, and a lot of apps.  On the down side, too many Android apps it is hard to remove.  It's not really intuitive, but doesn't take long to figure out how to work things more easily.  I has a beautiful sharp screen resolution for almost anything - movies, images, text, photos - plus some pretty good sound for a really light thin tablet. I didn't count the pixels, but they put on a really nice show.  It has WiFi, Bluetooth (a nice Logitech Bluetooth keyboard is almost required), and runs pretty fast with plenty of RAM and storage with space for up to 32Gb micro SD card to add to storage.  Micro USB port, micro HDMI port, earphone port, includes wall wart and cable to charge.  BTW, be patient - it will take at least ten to twelve hours to fully charge, but will last 8 - 10 hours between charges, so just plug it in when you go to bed.  Dead battery problem solved and resolved. My seller is really pleasant to deal with - so all I have is praise and a recommendation to BUY ONE.

Reviews.Title: awesome.
Reviews.Author: Garry H.
Reviews.Content: For the money this is by far the best tablet out there hands down!!! Would reccomend to anyone in search of a great tablet for not much money.

Reviews.Title: THIS IS A WONDERFUL TABLET
Reviews.Author: Roger
Reviews.Content: I received my tablet yesterday and have not put it down.  For the very FIRST TIME, I have a tablet that lives up to its billing.  This is a wonderful tablet in every respect.  High quality screen (true HD), fast (amazingly fast!), a keyboard that displays the numbers at all times across the top of the keyboard (makes great sense), and easy to use.  Sound is very good and I played a movie that streams well and sent the audio to my JBL bluetooth speaker system without a single issue.  It is also the first tablet that I had that captured all reception bars fully!  I have not tried the cameras yet, but I am sure that for what it is, they will work perfectly well...I usually do not use my tablet cameras so even if they do not live up to my standards, it's no biggy.If you are looking for a modestly priced tablet with some outstanding features and functionality, then give this a shot - I hope that you will be as satisfied as I am...and I hope my tablet continues to amaze me.  I'll update this if it doesn't, but I do not anticipate doing that.Roger

Reviews.Title: Very good and satisfying using experience
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Few words: Worth the money, meet my expectation of my daily uses of reading and managing files using tablet. Good Job Asus!

Reviews.Title: Nice Pad and does what we want!
Reviews.Author: Tom from Virginia
Reviews.Content: I wanted to get my wife a pad for surfing the net, pintrest, facebook, e-mail etc... This tablet is perfect, thin, light and a large super sharp screen.  Very pleased with the cameras too, both front and back.  Rear camera takes great shots or video.  Negative of a tablet is printing to our wireless printer doesn't happen without another program?  But that is a negative to the andriod and Ipad software I understand.  That's the only negative I can find so far,  I'd buy this again! For the money its a great value

Reviews.Title: Wonderful cost-effecting Android tablet!
Reviews.Author: Jesse A. Safir
Reviews.Content: I have three older Android tablets and several older Android phones.  My current phone is the GS4 and I love it.  I had Amazon gift card saved up and was looking to purchase an updated Android tablet that would be thinner, lighter, more rugged, and would perform much faster.  So far I am very pleased with this tablet.  The screen is bright and beautiful and it seems to perform very well so far.  I also appreciate some of these features ASUS has added to the stock Android UI.  I don't have root at this point so I haven't tried restoring my 700+ apps with Titanium Backup to see if that slows it down.  This tablet is thin and light.  I do with the speakers were a bit louder, however.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet decent price.
Reviews.Author: Andrew Warren
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this tablet. Screen res and clarity is amazing. Quick and responsive and works well. Speakers are the best I've heard on a tablet so far. Like that it has HDMI out for playing vids on the big screen if needed. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is it seems to have some issues of powering on (i.e, doesn't want to) when it is used with the Asus folio keyboard case we bought to go with it but that may be more to do with the case than the tablet but they are both Asus so they should be engineered to work together a little better I'd imagine.

Reviews.Title: top device
Reviews.Author: M. Grauer
Reviews.Content: very fast, very clear display, elegant slim , USB-OTG, charching a mobil on the (optional USB-OTG adapter is possible, great device

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: Med
Reviews.Content: I highlyrecommended ASUS MeMO Pad FHD 10 ME302C-B1-BL 10.1-Inch 32GB Tablet. Very satisfy of the resolution and the lot of the applications

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: larry purfield
Reviews.Content: I had a me301 tablet, and was losing my wifi all the time, but this me302c seems to have resolved the problem, it is a very good and reliable tablet

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: popeye1
Reviews.Content: I bought this budget tablet for its decent performance and it delivers.  I didn't have to wait as long as my first generation tablet to open web pages and the pinball games I play work smoothly.  This is the best $250 10" screen machine you can buy.

Reviews.Title: got for son
Reviews.Author: rick rogers
Reviews.Content: Son says "it's fantastic." Everything works great.  Now leave me alone"  He loves the graphics and says the sound is great. He's a gamer and will be taking this to Afghanistan with him for the down time. By the way , I did a lot of research before I bought this. This the best value you can get. Others were way more expensive than this with the same features. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: So pleased, I bought another for my wife
Reviews.Author: T. G. Smith
Reviews.Content: I'm almost overtly cautious when buying anything online, and read many of the comments about this ASUS MeMo 302C tablet on Amazon before deciding to buy.  I've used ASUS products before and have always found them to be of high quality.  This is the second tablet I've owned, and I'm very pleased with it's performance, graphics and build quality.  Someone said the back felt like cheap plastic, but I just don't see it.  It's performed perfectly with all apps I've put it through so far, and handles easily for its size (my hands are medium-sized).I was going to give my wife my 10 year-old Dell PC (I also have an HP Envy 15), which still runs great, but realized this tablet would be the perfect solution for her needs.  Bought another one and am setting it up for her.  I also bought two IVSO cases for our slates for protection.  I would recommend this tablet any time.  For the price, it can't be beat, imho.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Tablet
Reviews.Author: Ajay
Reviews.Content: I love this product. I have been shopping around  for a lot of tablets before settling for this one. Its thin and sleek and looks very close to an IPAD for a much lesser price,. It  also, has a long battery life and is very easy to set up. Took me just a fe minutes after unpacking to get going.

Reviews.Title: No regrets
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was debating between this and a Kindle Fire. I love android so went with this and so far I have absolutely no regrets. I love love love my Asus MeMo Pad FHD. It does what I need it to do. I am satisied with the display quality. I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Great value but has flaws.
Reviews.Author: Brian Briggs
Reviews.Content: Good display when using Asus Splendid, but battery life is less than expected. Easy to run and loads pages fairly quickly. Great value for the price. Fingerprints show too much.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Bert Cribb
Reviews.Content: Great product. Researched many and this seemed a no brainier. Far exceeded expectations and has so many great qualities. Would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Good value, but no flash support for Intel processor
Reviews.Author: Kevin Crandall "Kevin C."
Reviews.Content: This is my first 10" tablet (I upgraded from 1st gen kindle fire) and I really like it. It is responsive, has an excellent screen, and is light enough for me to use as an e-reader in bed. I also like that the storage capacity is upgradable (up to an additional 32 GB) via a microSD card.The biggest drawback is that there is limited support for some apps due to the intel processor. Most android tables use some form of an ARM processor and not all apps and plug-ins are optimized for the intel x86 architecture. I'm sure that this will change in time, but for now is somewhat of an inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: Received as a gift
Reviews.Author: amy
Reviews.Content: I like this tablet...the screen is clear and it is fairly easy to use.  Sometimes when on a website it does not let you scroll down in an extra window, it just keeps moving the entire page.About a week after I got it, it started having glitches.  One day, it wouldn't power on, but after holding the volume and power keys together it finally brought up a maintenance screen to reboot.Then sometimes the screen will just get snowy and then I have to do the same thing to shut it off and reboot...I would like to return it or exchange to Amazon, but since i didn't order it I guess I won't.

Reviews.Title: Super Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Patrick Freeman
Reviews.Content: After many months of research, I decided on the MeMo Pad. Got it for a good price and has all the features I need. I can also stream movies and flash-based web content with the penguin browser. It is fast and easy to use.  I've only had it for a few days so hoping that I won't have to return it like a couple of other tablets I've had to over the past year - fingers crossed. I find this tablet to be more than adequate and equally capable as some of the overpriced equivalents on the market (the fruit one especially). I am not a serious gamer of particularly obsessed with apps and such-like but I am pretty tech savvy. I would highly recommend for anyone looking for a functional tablet without all the excess gloss and over hype.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME Tablet
Reviews.Author: R. Brenner "rickyrosebud"
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet,its very fast,easy to use and see.....,without the size of a net book or laptop to lug around. Screen is ultra clear and sound is good also,if your considering a tablet this is the one.

Reviews.Title: cheap and powerful
Reviews.Author: Javier Flores Jiménez
Reviews.Content: I gave it 5 stars because although this is a cheap tablet, it has the potential to run games and apps smoothly. If you don‘t want to spend your money in an expensive device, this one is the most suitable for you. Asus Memo Pad FHD 10 teaches you that is not necessary to have an (overrated) iPad or Galaxy tablet to have real fun and quality.However, this one has a minor bug when it comes to the blocking screen. Sometimes when you want to unlock the tablet the touchscreen doesn‘t respond properly, but after a couple of attempts the touchscreen gets responsive again.

Reviews.Title: App compatibility in an issue
Reviews.Author: I. Erhard
Reviews.Content: This is one of the only android tablets running an intel GPU and I believe this is the reason I've come across a number of issues with apps. HBO GO, Showtime Anytime, WatchESPN, and MLB At Bat are the major streaming services that I've tried that either do not work properly or at all. While Intel promised 90% app compatibility, these are major apps that I find essential.If you can look past this (or find a workaround, I was able to side-load an older version of HBO GO that worked) this is a very good value. The full HD screen is crisp and makes web browsing a joy. I put a few of my own 1080p movies on the device and it looked great. You won't find another 10inch tablet that has a 1080p display for under $300. For this reason alone it is a good buy. The Intel processor, despite the compatibility issues, runs pretty smooth and you won't find any problems navigating the device or the web. Some of the more intense 3D games don't perform as well as the top end tablets, but from what I've tried, games like Real Racing 3, Asphalt 8, and Dragon Age are all certainly playable. They look great on the Full HD screen as well.So this will all come down to whether or not you are willing to put up with some major apps being unusable on this device. I don't see Asus supporting this tablet with any more updates, so these problems may never see fixing.

Reviews.Title: Purchased for my father
Reviews.Author: Dave Humes
Reviews.Content: I loved mine so much I bought one for my father so we could skype. He loves all the apps and almost never turns on his laptop anymore.

Reviews.Title: Very glad I changed to this tablet!
Reviews.Author: L. Onken
Reviews.Content: I knew we did not want an ipad for so many reasons, and I almost bought the new Microsoft version until I heard Windows 8 is so miserable, but at the last minute read several positive reviews about this tablet and they were right!  I bought this for my 14 year old daughter and she is just loving it!  She is extremely happy with it, the operating system and the apps available for it.  I have a Droid phone so I am happy that I do not have to yet learn another operating system.  This thing made everyone very very merry at Christmas!

Reviews.Title: No hassle, great screen, sound; fast!
Reviews.Author: Acontius "Acontius"
Reviews.Content: SIX WEEKS UDATE:  Very happy with hardware quality, Asus adaptation of Android, and connectivity options.  Love the SD card slot, drag and drop of music, vids, and pics.  Heartily recommending to friends.I decided to get a tablet because I am a pro photographer who needed a better way than binders to carry around portfolio photos.  I also want hand-held access to the many great reference books available online, but I don't plan extended reading.  If I did, I'd probably spend more to get the best 2560 screen.  (Note that my 5 star rating is for overall quality, usefulness, and value.  The screen itself is very good, but I did see better, so I'd give it a 4 star rating.  But at this price point, it shines.)I trusted this brand because I bought my first Asus laptop in China back in 2004--and it still works today (even with 750MB of RAM, Windows XP, and its little 40GB HDD.)  In 2010 I bought another Asus laptop, a powerful i7 machine with 12GB of RAM--and it's a true workhorse.So, Asus was an easy choice, one I'm glad I made.Contrast and color are excellent for portraits and fine art photos, and there is an important set of controls for color temp, hue, an saturation.  Streaming works great, which is also important to me, as I like to watch KelbyTraining and other videos.  The external sound is clear and loud, and with headphones, high quality for jazz and classical music.Build quality feels and looks excellent.  I like the ergonomics--even in kind of awkward positions, it's easy for me to pick this up and put it down one handed without feeling like it's going to slip.  Nice textured surface on the back without being rough or sticky.Using the tablet is, thankfully, super easy.  I tried quite a few others and had trouble with buttons, dropdowns, etc.  All easy for me on this MeMo.I'm finding it very fast for streaming, etc.  One thing I've learned is that sites like facebook and Youtube work better, faster, and smoother using an app rather than accessing through a browser.This tablet includes two browsers, Chrome and an Asus browser.  Chrome works much better for me.I went with Android because I wanted the most open system possible.  I might have chosen Windows, but the price and weight of those tablets was too much.  Like I mentioned, my needs are simple.I'm able to use an SD card to add storage space, and the OS on this tablet makes organizing photos a snap.  No dealing with crazy apps to load my own images onto my own device!  Just drag and drop!  Connects right to the USB port of my PC.Only thing I haven't tried yet is the HDMI port, but I can see it as useful for hooking to newer TV's to display photos and play slideshows.  I have to buy a cable.The virtual keyboard is easy to use, surprisingly.  For now, I really want just a cover for it, but I might consider one that includes a keyboard.All-in-all, a great choice.  There are a few video reviews here on Amazon that helped me a lot, especially one of the earliest ones.  Thanks for those!

Reviews.Title: Best budget tablet ever
Reviews.Author: sandeep
Reviews.Content: Great screenI played many games and they run pretty goodAwesome multitaskingGood batteryGreat buildCould have been good if the screen is protected with some kind of strong glass like gorilla glass or sapphire

Reviews.Title: Good tablet, exactly what I wanted.
Reviews.Author: S. Sampson
Reviews.Content: I shopped around a lot for the right tablet for a long time. Years in fact, all I knew was that I didn't want an ipad. But in October I finally got down to saying right, time to get one. So I was pretty sure that I was going to get a Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 10.1 32gb but I couldn't find a 32gb on amazon that didn't come with a bundle of some kind. Which might be great for you but the offer I saw I didn't like. Then the other 32gbs were Tab 2s.  And the Galaxy Note 32gb was too expensive and I didn't want to spend that much or need all of the processor. In fact I could only find the Tab 3 16gb for 399 and it went on sale for 299. So I had resigned myself to that. Then I found the Asus MeMO Pad FHD 10.1 32GB and it was priced at 299 on sale for Black Friday. It had the same chip and the 16gb Samsung tab 3, but double the ram and the storage. So it started to become a no-brainer. It had the removable SD storage, dual cameras, a Micro USB port and a Micro HDMI. And that pretty much sold it. I checked out some online reviews and the machine seemed like it would be fine and it is. It's my first tablet, and it does what I expected it to do, browse the internet, play a youtube video, connect to the cloud and allow me to read a book. I have not tried to play a movie yet but I don't expect that will be an issue. The speakers are great, clear and loud, good sound. The apps all work especially the ones I wanted. I have no complaints.I will say that patience in waiting for Black Friday, waiting for android 4.2, doing a lot of reading and reviewer research really helped me to make a decision on this tablet. Great purchase, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Good table
Reviews.Author: Ramon A. Colon Lugo
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a cheap table because i havent have to much money. I was search for a table with good performance, good CPU usage, good memory, good screen resolution and that users can buy a expand memory and installed. This ASUS table has everything i was looking for. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: It's an okay product really
Reviews.Author: Al Akshar M.D
Reviews.Content: Laggy, Sluggish sometimes.It is an okay product. I like (Pros+) the screen, speakers, mic, back, Battery life, Splendid, converter(Cons-) no need for the scenes as it really cause it to lag.... also no RAM manager. Can't tell how much RAM in thereTakes a lot of time to load PDF pages on its mybook reader.Can't handle games like Iron Man.Good for social apps, reading, browsing... so It is okay

Reviews.Title: Money well spent....
Reviews.Author: WLB
Reviews.Content: Computers are my business so I read many reviews all over the internet about this and other tablets before choosing this one. I was pretty confident this is what I was looking for so bought this one somewhere else because I wanted the 32 GB version for myself. At first I was a bit disappointed because this tablet seemed very slow just as some reviews implied. However, with some adjustments I have been very pleased with the performance, functionality, battery life, light weight and features of this tablet.After receiving it and spending about 2 weeks with it I bought another one on Amazon because I wanted a color other than black or blue for my daughter. But I had to get her the 16 GB version because Asus was not actually distributing the pink version in spite of their ads.Money well spent.

Reviews.Title: cost effective and nice array of features.
Reviews.Author: Sdulano
Reviews.Content: Great tablet for the money. Display is bright enough for anything except direct sunlight, the resolution works great for reading, battery life is as claimed. The only problems i see are that you cannot get it with a lot of storage space (<63GB) and it cannot accept more than 32GB in its micro SD slot but that applies to most tablets. As a workaround i plan on adding on a thumb drive when needed.

Reviews.Title: great tablet. 4.2.2 with a hi res display
Reviews.Author: Louie
Reviews.Content: i like it. it is a good deal. i like having 4.2.2 jelly bean. i like the hi res display. the speed is fine for how i use the tablet.update------i have had this item for 45 days and i still like it.i am glad i purchased this unit.i have loaded 50 apps and they all work just fine.be sure to charge it before using it.be sure to only plug it in when it needs charging.leave it unplug when it is charged and it will re-charge faster.

Reviews.Title: No Cons so far
Reviews.Author: John C.
Reviews.Content: First tablet for me...easy setup...taking some time to learn how to navigate, almost 10 hrs so far (after first charge & charging again now). Almost 11 GB still free, and I have added a 32GB card...had to convert my music files from wma to mp3 in order to get any player to work, and all music is headed to the card (made the conversion on my desktop machine and just copied them to the tethered MeMo Pad's new card). Asus keyboard works just fine after figuring out where other keys were on it (e.g. " ( ) @ etc), so I probably won't be buying a Bluetooth keyboard. I have big clumsy fingers, but have managed for the most part, and the stylus should arrive today for some testing that approach. No Cons so far - Love it!

Reviews.Title: Great value for money
Reviews.Author: Mahlzeit
Reviews.Content: Pros :Great interfaceMicro SD slotLarge screenAmazing SpeakerNice back casingAwesome priceCon :Camera quality

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: neelos
Reviews.Content: bought 3 of these already cause the tablet does everything for the price paid..  hope next version come with a flash ...highly recomended

Reviews.Title: Super fast and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Novlette
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my husband's birthday. He's a IT freak so I was wondering if it would meet his standard. He absolutely loves it. He uses it for everything and the battery life is amazing. You won't regret getting one.

Reviews.Title: Poor WIFI Conectivity
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: ASUS ia a nice Android Pad with many useful features however richt out of the box my Pad could not maintain a WIFI connection for very long without dropping it. I sent it in to ASUS repair facility for warrantee service and it was returned to me with the same WIFI connectivity problem. Their warrantee service department is very hard to communicate with. You must file for a RMA on their website and they communicate via email; which is fine. However communication on the progress of the repair is very poor. The unit was returned to me without any explanation of repair. I doubt they did anything to repair the MeMO Pad as it came back with the same problem. Repair Service takes a long time to respond to my emails and when they do there is no indication os what was found or fixed. I am still trying to work with them to correct the WIFI connectivity but it is taking forever. I will report any new progress on the resolution if it happens.

Reviews.Title: Was expecting a little more power
Reviews.Author: John "John"
Reviews.Content: Was hoping for a little bit more than what it has, I'm happy as it's my first tablet. My S4 seems to be more responsive/quicker. Maybe next time, still love asus though

Reviews.Title: Easy to use.
Reviews.Author: jw
Reviews.Content: Love the tablet but would have liked to have adobe flash player. I'm a technology challenged person so I'm sure there's ways to get things on tablet that I haven't figured out. Great for what I want to do. Still learning! Price was right so that's what counts. Very nice graphics and games are great.

Reviews.Title: Having some audio issues...
Reviews.Author: Fabian Rehm
Reviews.Content: When I gently touch my headphones whilst they are plugged in, I can't here any sound. Other than that, this product is great.

Reviews.Title: Fragile Screen
Reviews.Author: Yuanwei Chen
Reviews.Content: I have three android tablets (including this one), so I think I am able to give some comments.1. Screen: It is way too fragile! It got a 1-inch flaw on screen spontaneously after three days from delivery. I swear it has never been knocked or dropped. Now the flaw  is expanding to both margins after five days from delivery. The touch screen is totally losing control right now. I have to return or exchange this tablet!2. Battery control. As a 10.1 inch tablet, the battery of this tablet is draining faster than its 7.3 inch colleague (Asus MeMo Me173x) at both idle and working condition. IMHO, there is no reason for a 10.1 to get less battery time than a smaller tablet since it gets more space for battery.3. WiFi. Its signal sucks compared to its 7.3 inch colleague (Asus MeMo Me173x). I can never play a youtube MV continuously while Asus MeMO ME 173x does not have this issue under the EXACTLY same circumstances.

Reviews.Title: Bad to the bone
Reviews.Author: John C.
Reviews.Content: .........You just have to have had one before .....Ive owened two...this is a high quality tablet...I could go on and on about it....but Ill just say its very good, smoooothe Ive had it for two weeks and can find NO falts  and look forward to turning her on every time.

Reviews.Title: Great deal and works great.
Reviews.Author: Victor Galli
Reviews.Content: First tablet I have owned and I thoroughly enjoy it. It works well has a decent battery and the software works well. The only thing I can think of that i wish was a little better was the response time on some of the touches aren't as fast as I would like.

Reviews.Title: It does everything I needed it to.
Reviews.Author: Robert Hoffman
Reviews.Content: I purchased one of these for myself about a month or so ago and I liked it enough that I purchased another for my wife's birthday. I hope she enjoys hers it as much as I enjoy mine. I hope it plays the games she likes to play on her daughters android tablet. I am not sure since this has an intel prosesser. I don't understand all that stuff. That being said I think it has a great display, a responsive touchscreen, and good battery life.

Reviews.Title: Fairly good.
Reviews.Author: S. Kendel
Reviews.Content: I've had this for a little while now and have to say it is fairly good. It works pretty quick, has good battery, and is easy to operate overall. I am coming from an iPad 2. I like how it is a little more free to use and configure than the iPad.A couple of things that bug me are the inability to put apps onto the microSD card and the way it is REALLY laggy on games like songpop and moviepop in particular. Then there is the random cases where the app just quits or stops responding and crashes. The ram usage on it is a bit aggravating as well. Without using the cleanmaster app after every app use, I figure it would bog down more.Seems like the overall file and memory management features of Android is a bit lacking or else you wouldn't have to run an app to free up ram or clean junk files to keep the tablet running smoothly. Maybe that is just the Asus version of Android that is on here. It comes with 4.2, but if you run system update on it, it goes up to 4.3. No idea when or if it will get updaed more.Basically, I would say this is a good, somewhat inexpensive, versatile, easy to use tablet for a first time user. Any other questions I may have forgotten to address, just ask.

Reviews.Title: a lot of tablet for the money
Reviews.Author: Higin SC
Reviews.Content: Great value, and it doesn't feel "cheap" to me (seen a few posts here to that effect). Plenty of processing power and ram. Happy to have micro-sd, hdmi-out, and standardized charge port.  Speakers are loud (for a tablet) and clear.  Very happy.

Reviews.Title: Feature Rich, Good display, excellent stereo audio but slightly sluggish touch response
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: For the price its a good buy. Feature packed. I have used the ARM chip tablets in the same league (Lenovo). Overall ok, audio is good and display is crisp. Touch response is not the fastest compared to the Ipads and the Samsungs... not built for speed.

Reviews.Title: Very high quality
Reviews.Author: Renee W.
Reviews.Content: As good as any nexus device. The intel processor has proved to be just as good as Snapdragon and Tegras. It does come with a little bloatware but its easily uninstalled. It has been able to run every game we have tried including gta san andreas and other high end games. The build quality is excellent and the price is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: very good  tablet
Reviews.Author: gregory camacho
Reviews.Content: better than what i expected. speed is great this is a very good tablet. great price i should of got to for the price i pay

Reviews.Title: Stop worrying, this is really good
Reviews.Author: KD
