Reviews.Author: mr. sniffles
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this tablet from an external website but had to send it back because of damage during shipping but for the short time i had it i absolutely loved it! I'm mostly using this tablet for school and entertainment purposes and it meets both incredibly well the screen is stunning and very responsive which is complemented by the sleek design and grippy back. It is not the highest quality tablet but make no mistake it's still very high quality. All apps i tried on it worked with the only problem being some taking a bit longer to load due to an older processor but not long enough to ruin it.

Reviews.Title: I love it so much and enjoy!
Reviews.Author: Marcelino Villamin
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad to have this product and I will recommend this tablet to my friends. I haven't encounter any technical problem. so far so good. Thanks ASUS!

Reviews.Title: My first Tablet .
Reviews.Author: James M. Hamlin
Reviews.Content: After a good many hours of research I chose this tablet based on price and features .  so far I seem to have made a good choice .

Reviews.Title: Very nice tablet
Reviews.Author: Cathy Corbitt
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up and a pleasure to use.  I recommend this tablet for anyone.Only con, has too many pre-added apps.

Reviews.Title: memo pad is awsome
Reviews.Author: james r postell
Reviews.Content: this memo pad is the best pad ive ever had or used, I have no dislikes its awesome, I love it.. and I would recommend this pad to any one who is looking for a memo pad. I would buy a asus over a I pad any day....

Reviews.Title: problems with the power switch  have owned for 2 mo.
Reviews.Author: jim d
Reviews.Content: Almost immediately had difficulty turning on when switched off! At times have a glitch where a fabric looking image obscures the screen and computer needs restarting. My primary means of starting computer is the side recessed restart button.

Reviews.Title: Super sharp graphics
Reviews.Author: John Harrington
Reviews.Content: By far the best tablet on the market in this price range. Easy set up, my 5 year old grandson was able to create a folder on the desktop and put his favorite apps in it all by himself. (showed grandma a few tricks). The screen resolution is much better than my husbands Samsung Tab. Apps load fast and I have had no problems with it freezing up or being slow to respond. Love it.

Reviews.Title: no problems so far
Reviews.Author: Anthony Roger Lynch
Reviews.Content: Love my tablet. So far it does all I want it to. Had a problem with streaming media but that was fixed when I installed Puffin browser. I have not had it long enough yet to fully work it out but so far so good.

Reviews.Title: It's a great poduct!
Reviews.Author: CPérez
Reviews.Content: This is a great product for the price, it is fast enough to do whatever I want (considering tablet's capabilities). I am glad to have chosen this one and I would recommend it to anyone looking to buy his/her first tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Judy W.
Reviews.Content: I love, love, love this tablet  First, I am a novice at tech so I had to do my homework. I read every tech and consumer review and comparison i could find on an android tablet. Asus won me over. It does what any other high end tablet can do and better all at a budget price. I am also very pleased with Amazon. As the hoilday kept getting closer, the price kept dropping. I bought it almost $100 cheaper than anyother site and Amazon gave me free shipping  If you are on abudget and undecided, go with an Asus Pad. You won't be sorry  It has speed, great sound and the screen resolution is ausome!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!
Reviews.Author: Jim C.
Reviews.Content: After using an iPad, I decided to purchase a 10 inch tablet. After researching, I came across the Asus Memo Pad FHD 10 as a highly rated option, for much less money. After using it for a couple of weeks now, I love it! I hope that feeling stays as I use it more.

Reviews.Title: My wife loves it so it's great!
Reviews.Author: Dave Beam
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift for my wife who would still prefer a rotary phone so I was apprehensive getting this for her. She has been doing great with a reasonable learning curve time frame.I like the graphics but wish it was a bit faster.

Reviews.Title: My first tablet...really enjoying it!
Reviews.Author: Cheryl B.
Reviews.Content: For my birthday I was given the ASUS MeMO pad HD 7 inch, this tablet was too small for me so I purchased the 10 inch and I am really glad I bought the 10 inch, I really like the bigger tablet.  I enjoy using my tablet, I’m glad I purchased it, easy to use, works well when playing games, wish the camera had a flash.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant display, easy to use
Reviews.Author: Rolf Bartels
Reviews.Content: This tablet is easy to use and display is brilliant.WLAN connection is easy to install.Operation is fast enough for internet surfing ans skype is also running perfect, which are the two main reasons why I have bought it.Unfortunately it takes several hours to recharge it.

Reviews.Title: Great product, worth every penny considering the higher cost of similar spec'ed models.
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: Considering the specs of the tablet, it's price\value is exactly what you want.Taking into account more costly tablets in the same class like the Galaxy Tab3, this one has better processor, better screen for 50$ less, so, what's there to hate?The build is solid, some people complain about the cheap feeling of the back-cover, personally I can't see the problem, has a nice(though plasticy) feel to it.A very good product.

Reviews.Title: Loved the tablet
Reviews.Author: Chirschi
Reviews.Content: Found the tablet to be a little less than I wanted, but gave 2 of them to my sons and they are overjoyed. Pluses: the big one was the battery life. It really lived up to mfg claims. Good viewing experience and easy and quick to learn. Download nearly instant. Liked the price too. Bought an iPad air to replace one I gave to second son. Battery life shorter. But operates and charges exactly like my iPhone. Very fast. Takes a little longer to charge battery. Did find that scrabble would not download to Asus, which is a big deal to me because I like to play online.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: F. Nakamoto
Reviews.Content: I think this is possibly better than the Apple iPad.I would highly recommend this to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: ASUS MeMO Pad FHD 10 ME302C-A1-BL 10.1-Inch
Reviews.Author: Mich97nc
Reviews.Content: The tablet has been great. The picture is outstanding and it has run everything I have put on it. I also put some MP4 videos on the tablet and the picture and sound are excellent. I would recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware!!! Of a great product that is. An iPad for 1/2 the price? I'll take one of those
Reviews.Author: Denise Saville
Reviews.Content: It's an iPad... for half the price.The GoodPlays all the apps smooth and fast. Screen is very rich in color and sharp. Touch sensitivity is very precise. Battery life is better than expected. Wi-fi connection is great, no dropped connections as of yet. Tons of apps available at Google Play. OS runs great. Very light weight, which is why some people are of the oppinion that it feels cheap. Strap a lead brick to the back if you're one of these people and it will feel nice and heavy.The BadSpeakers seem to be a little under-powered at times. Charger cable is already loose, so be careful unplugging. Sometimes it hangs up for a second when I try to rotate the display.The UglyScreen gets very oily, very fast, but maybe that's just my kids grubby little fingers? Definitely benefits from a screen protectorThe VerdictThe tablet really is not that much different than my iPad. The major differences are the wight, the plastic backing, the speakers and the Operating System. And at 1/2 the price, it's a better investment than a $99 Wal-Mart special tablet. Asus has been making some pretty good products lately, and this tablet is another great product of theirs. 4 years ago, I don't think I owned any Asus products. Today, I have 4 or 5 Asus products, all of which were purchased using comparative shopping, reading reviews, etc...not just picking something becasue it said Asus on the box. It just turns out that they are making some great products.

Reviews.Title: i enjoy it very much
Reviews.Author: nurit amitay "nuty60"
Reviews.Content: and i will use it later on for work purposes.i wish though it would open more audio files than it does

Reviews.Title: Great Little Tool
Reviews.Author: Corey L.
Reviews.Content: Works great!  My only complaint is with Android 4.x, and not the device itself!  I love the ease of use, the battery life is incredible, and the screen is crystal clear and sharp as a razor.  To make it perfect, Asus needs to upgrade the rear camera to 8 megapixel or greater.  Otherwise, a great buy!

Reviews.Title: poor for email
Reviews.Author: Richard R Leipzig
Reviews.Content: Email attachments do not open. Error message tells me to go to play store and down load app. It does not say what app.  Google has all kinds of info, but no help.

Reviews.Title: It has everything!
Reviews.Author: Sina
Reviews.Content: I certainly love this tablet. It has a great Full HD Screen and it's as fast as you expect it to be. Something I like about Asus tablets is that they are very handy. The design very good (specially the back-side). The only problem you may have with it is finding a good case because it is a bit longer than ipad and galaxy tab.

Reviews.Title: enjoy this item everyday
Reviews.Author: Jlotze23
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with my purchase.  This tablet in my opinion is better than ipad.Light weight, nice grip, works smoothly and fast.  No complaints here.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Paul Vaughan
Reviews.Content: Really happy with the size, weight, screen resolution and performance. People complain about the back texture, but I really like it.

Reviews.Title: This Tablet is B+
Reviews.Author: Bovone Vongsarasinh
Reviews.Content: Not a bad tablet at all considering for the price $249.00,,Damm the Atom chip cost more then that. Display screen is awesome in my view, others may not think so but you know what?, too bright will kills your eyes sight in the long run, I dimmed to 50% and is still look good. Tell you the truth I wanted Ipad Air but is too pricey for me and you know what? they might come out next year or two with the new Ipad Air 2 (just guessing) then what ? Ipad Air would become obsolete. So I bought The Memo and saved $250. This Memo 10 can do and perform very well compare to the Ipad and Samsung Brands. In the mean time, I'll enjoy using this Memo for while until if I decide to get a new one. That Mean I'll use the $250 that I've saved toward my what ever going to be my new tablet.Hey Asus you need to produced more high quality tablet but cost less than your competitors and you will gain consumers market tremendously . You got me!

Reviews.Title: Started off good
Reviews.Author: Johanna Emerson
Reviews.Content: But then it decided to quit charging - I would leave it plugged in for 8 hours while I was at work and the battery might gain 10%.I was just finally allowed to put in an RMA after the third try talking to their "Technical Support" who recommended a factory reset and an unauthorized, underpowered charger.To add a cherry on top of this steaming crap sundae, after blowing a few hours dealing with their tech support, they dont even provide the courtesy of providing a prepaid shipping label which has been pretty standard practice for the last decade.  Asus it seems is no longer the great hardware company that they used to be

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: Bill B.
Reviews.Content: Excellent, battery could use improment with about 4 hrs of use before recharge, but over all great tablet. External keyboard a big plus.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful machine
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Rowan "Acceptance is the answer"
Reviews.Content: This is a good machine.  Still learning about it but it seems to be a strong machine. Looking forward to learning more about the machine

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for those that know what they are buying.
Reviews.Author: David Eric Hibshman "Hibish"
Reviews.Content: The resolution of this tablet is awesome and unmatched for it's price range.  It's not a super fast latest 3d gamer, but otherwise is very powerful.  The x86 cpu has some draw backs as not every app under the sun works, but every app I use except for flash player runs fine.  I can't watch Amazon Prime, but frankly the prime experience on a tablet or computer sucks anyway.  I watch my own digital library of high quality HD movies on it all the time.  This is a great tablet for the price if you understand it isn't a typicsl ARM baseb tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: newdad
Reviews.Content: This tablet is amazing.  Got it for my mother who was against it,  but she loves it because it's so easy to use.

Reviews.Title: What a deal...
Reviews.Author: Gary F Lewis
Reviews.Content: This little gem is absolutely great. The sound is magnificent. It can do anything that the big boys can do for more than half the price because the name isn't as well know. I bought it because of reviews like the one I'm writing.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the right price
Reviews.Author: Benjamin Ramel
Reviews.Content: Bought this device based on various web reviews and quite satisfied with the product. CPU speed is decent to great depending on usage. I mainly use it for browsing and educational apps, and performance was very good. Loading times can be a bit slow for heavier apps but still tolerable. Scrolling web pages was smooth with the occasional "hopping" for larger content-based sites, but minimal inconvenience here.Weight was just right at under 600 gms. Got the 32GB storage and was happy with the decision with available storage ~23GB left. I think 16GB would have sufficed as well but for about $10 difference I went for the larger one and avoided having to buy a microSD card (at least for the medium term).As expected, there are a number of pre-installed apps but they are by no means bloated. I particularly appreciate the minimal customization of the OS to still enjoy the native Android system. Also found the quick-flick notification and settings bar at the top very useful to disable wifi and adjust brightness settings quickly.Overall, it's hands-down value for money.

Reviews.Title: Windows 7 user
Reviews.Author: Rollie D. Newton "R. Newton"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife who is mostly computer illiterate.  Neither of us had any tablet or smartphone experience prior to this purchase and there has been a fair amount just getting used to this type of device.  I'm most comfortable with Windows 7.The touch screen does seem inconsistent, but that could just be our inexperience.  It is frustrating though when you are scrolling down and suddenly you realize that you touched and called up another screen.  Scream!!!!!!  A month into using this, it is getting easier, but the primary reason for the four stars is that I found out that Adobe flash doesn't support Android devices beyond 4.0.  I tried the Adobe archive fix, but couldn't get it to work.  The Asus support guy helped me get the facebook app that will play the flash videos so that was good.  I also really like being able to say google and telling it to search something for me. The voice recognition is very impressive.

Reviews.Title: Love Love This
Reviews.Author: Sandra
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews on this product before buying it and it really is as great as been described..

Reviews.Title: Impressed
Reviews.Author: Brett
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife and she loves it. Still learning all the features but for the price you can't beat it. I checked it out on You Tube and virtually every review was positive. They of course compare it to the IPad which isn't fair but you might be surprised by what was said. I have a Nexus 7 which I swear by but am looking for a larger tablet and I am leaning towards this one.

Reviews.Title: ASUS 10 Inch Tablet
Reviews.Author: JoAnn Howdyshell
Reviews.Content: The tablet meets all my expectations, but one.  The power button functions odd because when you depress it you do not receive a noticeable sound or feeling in your finger that you have actually turned it on.  I love the screen size.  I have used a 7 inch screen, but really prefer the larger screen.

Reviews.Title: Better than an iPad!
Reviews.Author: Sheng-Min Shih
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love it. It's fast, user-friendly, stylish for a very reasonable price. The CPU is very powerful so everything run faster. I have been using it for a month haven't find a thing to pick on it.

Reviews.Title: Love this device
Reviews.Author: dominic
Reviews.Content: I'm a droid user, and it's just like using my phone in most cases. I like the high definition picture and video, but the camera isn't as good as i'd like it to be.

Reviews.Title: Does exactly as the description says.
Reviews.Author: Heavy "Heavy"
Reviews.Content: Well pleased with this tablet! Excellent resolution of screen. Easy to set up if you have ever used an android device.

Reviews.Title: good tablet
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: Mine had issues.. I loved the tablet when it was working..the problem was sleep mode, some times it wouldn't turn on..I would have to hold power and manually reset ..other times it would come on but freeze on the lock screen..unfortunately I returned it.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: John Ferguson
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet.  Got if for my fiancee and she absolutely loves it.  Fast processor, sufficient RAM and an amazing display!  Plus Asus makes some of the most reliable products so i know i can trust them.  Great buy!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: James R. Asberry, Jr.
Reviews.Content: Gave this as a gift to my 86 year old mom.she loves email and Internet search. Has voice search, camera is very good. I set it up for her and she just started using it today. So far very happy.

Reviews.Title: VERY impressed with this after the first day of setup and use.
Reviews.Author: Ray Crosier
Reviews.Content: Bought this to use solely for music lyrics while playing (drums) and singing.  The person I play music with has a tablet for her chords to play guitar and sing, so I got this for my drums and lyrics (have about 300 songs we cover).Screen is great, very clear, works surprisingly fast, and combined with the Folio Keyboard case (see review on that, it is NOT made for this, and WILL require modifications, and will void warranty if you do them), it is awesome!Sound is good, too.  I've also installed a free Metronome app, and g-strings app.  Both work well on it.  Spotify sounds great, too!I didn't want to spend a ton on a 10.1" tablet, or as much as a 13+" tablet might cost, JUST to use for my lyrics in PDF format.  This is just the ticket for that, and I can see all the lyrics on one page just fine!I'll report back on the battery life after I've used it for a couple gigs.

Reviews.Title: excellent product for price.
Reviews.Author: Mchos
Reviews.Content: Performs as promised. I use in classroom for entering grades and blogging in edmodo. A little heavy to carry around and use constantly in class but display is great. Camera good up close. Blurrier picts more than 8 feet away. Love love love the tablets for classroom.

Reviews.Title: Some apps dont work.
Reviews.Author: rks
Reviews.Content: I got this from office depot.  nice screen.. clear sound though not as loud. fast enough.. good price.. However some of the apps don't work.  One app which I really need don't work with intel processor.. I will need to return it.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: DualSportRider "Überschall"
Reviews.Content: Seems to work great,  not super fast but didn't' expect it to be.  Firefox and adobe installed fine.  Maybe they fixed the issue's others have made comments about.  But Firefox is slower than Chrome on the tablet.  I like it better than my Ipad2 which this replaced.  Seems stable so far.  4 stars because there's always room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!!!!
Reviews.Author: Mario
Reviews.Content: I am very very very happy with this tablet, super fast, the internet works amazing, the interface is very easy to use. Very Very good quality. the best.

Reviews.Title: Best low-cost performer in the 10-inch tablet line
Reviews.Author: Carl Witthoft
Reviews.Content: Great deal for the price -- fast processor, solid display.  My only complaint is that the stock  OS doesn't allow superuser (the whole su , chown, and so on branch is missing, and simple root tools don't help).  Otherwise,  movies, games,  websurfing, and the cool "forward // no,  reverse"  camera controls are just great.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet.
Reviews.Author: Phil
Reviews.Content: Works great.  Vivid, sharp screen  Strong wifi signal.  No issues.  Easy to setup and start using.  Also got the rooCASE which fits well and puts the tablet in sleep mode when the cover is closed.

Reviews.Title: Quality tablet, user friendly
Reviews.Author: blynky
Reviews.Content: Love, love, love my new tablet! Functional, user friendly, great quality product. Use it all the time. Very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Awesome picture and its FAST!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer D. Christianson
Reviews.Content: Awesome tablet!  It has a great picture and its FAST!!  It is light, and I like the texture on the back of it, it wont show fingerprints.  If i was going to make a great product better, it would be to include a longer USB cable.  I don't know why the Trans cover isn't available in the USA yet tho.

Reviews.Title: i am addicted
Reviews.Author: Nancy from Rockford "scissors"
Reviews.Content: so fast..love it..its quite a bit different than what i am use to..slow and steadily i am learning..its a smart buy

Reviews.Title: Asus ME302c-B1-Bl 10.1-inch 32 GB Tablet
Reviews.Author: Daniel C.
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet, did not want apple (not enough apps), samsung was a little more $, Asus was the third in my top 3, & the price was right. (1,000,000,000 apps) I'm very satisfied this this tablet......

Reviews.Title: it is fine at this price point
Reviews.Author: matt.mingkee
Reviews.Content: I am sure many customers are attracted with this tablet because the price is good. I give this tablet a try because I am pretty tired high price of Samsung tablets and the company's attitude (hey, where is Trad Chinese support???)This tablet is kind of mixed bag for veteran Android users.This is the first X86-based Android tablet for me.Quanrant is around 5700 and Antutu is around 15500.Good:2GB RAM is pretty decent.1920*1200 is good when watching videos (a tip: get MXPlayer because stock video player sucks)It supports 64GB microSD.It supports USB host.Sound is loud with 4.7.3 ROM.It is thin.Asus bloat isn't that much.Bad:Screen is way too warm (about 4500k when Splendid is set to 0) even setting Splendid to -10. Solution: install screen adjuster to fine tune RGB.EXTREMELY ANNOYING high volume warning and it is set on 50%!!!!!Possible software compatibility problem because it's X86-based.Battery is a bit short when playing HD Homerun.Indeed, Memo Pad FHD is truly good if you want a basic tablet and 2GB RAM definitely leaves you more space for running apps.

Reviews.Title: Tablet has charging issues after 2 months
Reviews.Author: Jean1960 "Jean"
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to give a product description and repeat what the listing already says, I just want to give a review on my 2 month experience with the asus memo. I have had this Android tablet for 2 months and for the most part I can say that I like it (except that I was very bummed to find out that you cannot view your Amazon Prime videos on an Andoid tablet but you can on an iPad). We bought this tablet for 3 features that our iPad lacked: 1) Flash support  2) ability to upload pictues on ebay, amazon, etc.  3) browser does not refresh everytime the back button is hit or when changing tabs - very annoying and time consuming on iPad Safari (waiting while it refreshes every time you change screens).  The graphics on the asus memo are wonderful, sharp with great color, smooth videos. Internet is fast.  I did not see much bloatware at all on mine. The Andoid OS runs smooth, no problems there.However the Asus tablet does have some flaws, the major one being that the battery has started to give me problems charging. Yes I followed the instructions before using it to charge the battery. Now I leave it plugged in for 8 hours and it says its half charged.  I leave it plugged in another few hours and its fully charged, but after only 2 hours of use the battery is dead again and the tablet shuts down. They claim in the advertisement that the battery has a 10 hour use, that must mean for the first month. When I first bought it it charged quickly with in a couple of hours and would last all day of use. (This could be an app using excessive battery, so I will research it more and update this later.)Apparently it does not charge while in use (unlike my iPad which charges the battery WHILE I'm using it). If I use the asus while the charger is plugged in it tells me that the battery is drained and shuts down. For example, yesterday it said the battery was getting low (5%) so I plugged the charger in but it still powered itself down. I turned it back on, it ran for a few minutes then powered itself down. If you plan on running any big updates or downloads of your music collection, backing up, etc make sure the battery is fully charged and hope that your update/download/backup does not take longer than the battery life because it will not charge while in use.Another problem I have with this tablet is that the touchscreen can be downright flaky. Many times I have to click a couple times on something before it registers and then often it will enlarge the text instead of selecting it. So I tap, nothing, tap again, nothing, tap, tap, enlarge, tap again, finally works.You can long press to copy and paste text, but I find that tap and hold to paste the text is often cumbersome because again it wants to enlarge instead of bringing up the paste button. so I end up doing a long press then tap then double tap them long press then tap press and paste. Also annoying is the word suggestion bar, as you type words pop up, its predicting what you are typing and you can click on the word, helpful for long words but annoying for normal use.  It slows down typing for me. Hitting the backspace requires hitting it more because first you have to delete the predicted word.If you want to use Adobe Flash then be prepared to have to manually install it. Adobe Flash stopped supporting Android after version 4.0. I used instructions found online that did work to install flash so it is working now.That was one reason I bought the Android tablet because the apple iOS doesn't support flash and found out that the newer Android doesn't either (you have to manually install a set of instructions as a work around to the OS.)Android has a Google Play store which is similar to the iPad itunes App Store. You set up a Google account so if there is an app you want to buy it will charge it to the account. There are many useful free apps.I would give it 5 stars if this was based on android 4.2 only, because the OS is superb. But the asus tablet itself has some shortcomings with the battery not charging while plugged in, the battery not lasting very long  after 2 months and the touch screen being flaky.*** I would like to add that it seems whenever I give a negative review that I quickly get a few votes for NO to the "Was this Review Helpful?" question listed under the review. I believe that people who sell or make the product have a vested interest and some may try to make a review appear "not helpful" if it is a negative review. In my opinion sellers and retailers should not be allowed to review products and should not vote on reviews because it skews the entire rating system.

Reviews.Title: ASUS MEMO PAD
Reviews.Author: Beth O'Connor
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I'm kind of iffy giving this review.  Maybe it was just a fluke...?  Nonetheless, I think it's a fluke other potential buyers should know about.  I bought two of these - one for my sister, one for myself.  My sister's was for her birthday, so I was using mine for about two weeks before she was using her's.  Tablets are easy to set up.  A matter of minutes, really.  I had only one problem with mine in that one of my favorite nerdy word game apps would freeze...too often for my liking.  My sister's tablet, on the other hand, would randomly freeze in the middle of anything.  It would also shut off...just completely shut down.  I have a PC, my sister has a laptop...so she wasn't on this tablet all that much.  I ended up restoring my tablet to factory default and giving it to her and buying myself another tablet (non-Asus).

Reviews.Title: Asus ok, Android not
Reviews.Author: Quil "Phil"
Reviews.Content: Has a very good screen.  Not a speedy machine, not touted to be.  Don't like the on/off switch.  Must try multiple times sometimes to get it to fire up.  Shutdown often tells me its shutting down, it goes black, then a few minutes later I look at it and its up and running on its own.  Just have to watch it.Google has a chokehold on its users with Android.  They know where you live (GPS that pinpoints you before you can tell it no), who you are, and everything about you and that info is for sale or grabs by Uncle.  They want you to use Chrome, not Firefox.  You can work around it and download Firefox although it is crippled.  One of the crippling features is you cannot add FOLDERS so your Bookmarks page will get lengthy and problematic.  I can tell Google NO, NO, NO, in my preferences and when you upgrade it is taken to mean YES.  Its like "What part of NO do they not understand"?All in all I'd probably do it again if it were running Windows.  Android?  From here on I prefer my freedom to what they want to take away.

Reviews.Title: Unsatisfactory Purchase
Reviews.Author: Catwomanmija
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my mother's Christmas present.  PLEASE don't waste your time or money.  The tablet was used with kid gloves for a whopping 4 months and then it suddenly decides that it can turn itself on or off anytime it's moved.  ASUS used to have excellent technical support but it seems that they've either outsourced their technical support department to another country or someone now gets points if they don't accept that their products have a hardware issue.  All together I've spent 8 + hours getting an RMA to return the bad unit and I may get it back in a week or 10 days.  All total 3 weeks down time.  TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Riley
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for somebody else. But I have continuant heard good things back from him. He loves it

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: V. Sciuto
Reviews.Content: Great pad! It does everything I needed it for. It definitely gets my recommendation. In fact, I have a friend ready to order one for himself after seeing mine. :)

Reviews.Title: Asus Memo Pad FHD 10
Reviews.Author: Dinesh
Reviews.Content: Its superb fast, cool and has everything things a tablet should have.A full HD Screen. Excellent sound.The only thing is does not have is calling capability but that's fine.

Reviews.Title: It WAS great.
Reviews.Author: Kirsten Grooms
Reviews.Content: Lovely tablet. But flimsy screen. I was cleaning the screen. Lightly, I might add(I'm an artist. I'm very very light handed) Just enough pressure to make the screen shiny again. And the screen cracked. All the way across. It's still under warranty but ASUS is claiming that it was user abuse so they won't fix it unless I pay half of what I already spent on the thing. Using shoddy materials then blaming the consumer when they fail. Isn't that nice of them? :)Edit: Tablet has been sitting unused on my desk since first screen crack. Some how it's gotten another giant crack. Nothings been sat on it or anything.

Reviews.Title: Windows 7 stopped recognizing the Asus Memo Pad FHD 10
Reviews.Author: J. Lundberg
Reviews.Content: The first few days, my pc running Windows 7 recognized the Asus Memo pad when connected with a USB cable. I could transfer files just fine. Then, a few days later, my computer completely stopped recognizing the device. I would plug the USB cable in and the pop up box would come up on the computer screen to open the folders inside the Asus. Then I would click to open the folders and nothing. Nothing would open up. I tried opening the developer menu on the Asus and enabling USB debugging mode and still nothing. I do a lot of file swapping between my pc and my tablet so this was a deal breaker for me. I found the Asus to be completely unreliable with the USB connection. Asus customer service was no help either. I never had one problem connecting to Windows 7 with my Samsung Galaxy. I also had some noticeable backlight bleeding with the Asus Memo Pad during dark scenes in movies. The screen resolution and speed was good with the Asus but just not a keeper for me.

Reviews.Title: great tablet!!
Reviews.Author: Jacky
Reviews.Content: It works perfektly fine the Batterie is still not as good and it takes some time to charge but otherwise its great

Reviews.Title: tablet rating
Reviews.Author: ray kozykoski
Reviews.Content: Since this was my first tablet, I cannot compare it with others. The first one sent to me would not function without plugging in to an outlet. It was returned and the second one worked okay but is slow with some web pages and some visuals do not display. I have only had it for a month and considering the price I am satisfied overall.

Reviews.Title: Asus Memo Pad
Reviews.Author: gary w harper
Reviews.Content: This tablet replaced the previous Asus EEEtablet which was retired due to screen failure after several years of abuse. The previous tablet had the extra keyboard with batteries which enabled 8-10 hours of use. This new tablet is very thin, has wonderful graphics and color, good processor, memory, and speed. Even without the extra batteries the run time is 8-10 hours, also. I am very pleased with the included apps and features. I highly recommend it. The only thing to note is the absence of Adobe Flash which is no longer available for new Android devices. Good job ASUS!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet - beats an Apple Ipad 8to the core +++++Intel MicroProcessor+++++
Reviews.Author: Intelguru "Intelguru"
Reviews.Content: Bought this as an early Christmas present for my wife.  She loves it and cannot put it down.  I checked it out - the WIFI on my cable internet is fast and seems to be a very stable platform.

Reviews.Title: a better iPad just under publicized
Reviews.Author: Sophie Shao
Reviews.Content: I owned an iPad 4 64GB, then just got this one. Asus makes it better. Briefly -better or as good display, lighter than iPad, better sound, more stuff packed in, such as gps support, micro sd support, etc., also good battery life... very pleased! Known ASUS for many years. I know they would do it great, but i am just convinced.Just one thing - but may be an android issue rather than Asus' - ran into browser issues on some sites, which worked fine on Safari. (or perhaps setting issue - the site written in jQUERY - if you know what it is)Great job ASUS!

Reviews.Title: Outrageously good deal
Reviews.Author: Phillip Madeira
Reviews.Content: This tablet is amazing for it's price. My first tablet (Acer A100) was a 7'' tablet for 249.00 and it is stuck and Ice Cream Sandwhich with no future updates, so i felt like it was time to upgrade. To get a 10.1" tablet with 2 GB of RAM and a Full Hd Screen for the same price was awesome. The 2 GB of RAM makes a difference when running applications.If you want a great tablet for a great price, look no further.

Reviews.Title: It is a great purchase
Reviews.Author: shermin_e
Reviews.Content: I love it, it is light, beautiful and handy! The screen is clear and the screen touch sensitivity is wonderful! I love it!

Reviews.Title: this is the second try at this machine
Reviews.Author: E. Henson "River Ed"
Reviews.Content: quite frankly I thought for the money this would be a good buy. But it turned out that not only does it have issues with plugging in the machine but it has issues with crashing.I've contacted asus and they told me to send it in and they will look into it and it'll take 7 to 15 days for me to get my machine back, which is fine but they don't guarantee that they're going to be able to fix it.I asked if this is a known issue ( my machine tells me " insufficient charging current") I'm using the cord they supplied... so i tried other cords... same message...Now every few hours the screen scrambles and it makes this awful sound until i can get it to shut off.... I will never buy another... it is an expensive piece of crap.... I am certainly not happy with this purchase at all!!!!

Reviews.Title: normal
Reviews.Author: GERARDO C.
Reviews.Content: linings for a phone the description I can give is all normal, very good finish and simple will not find any problem

Reviews.Title: i don,t know what you want here.
Reviews.Author: Leroy
Reviews.Content: still trying to learn all the things you can do on it. i have a friend is helping me to learn.

Reviews.Title: Second defective tablet
Reviews.Author: michael
Reviews.Content: First one did not work out of the box.  Second one worked for 2 months and now will not switch on.  Power button started to malfunction and now completely dead.  Will not be buying Asus products again.

Reviews.Title: Asus Me302C Pad
Reviews.Author: Richard Ross
Reviews.Content: I've had the Asus Me302C Pad for about 6 months and love it. The display is exceptional. It is very light, but also feels durable. You can find faster tablets but it still feels very quick and video is always completely smooth.  If you need more than the 16GB of built-in storage you can easily and inexpensively add a 16 or 32GB micro SD card. I have found that children using the pad have have been able to release the micro sd card and loose it,this has happened to me twice. Watch out for this Short of this, this is a great pad

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: RH
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my child. They love it. It is a very thin and lightweight tablet even with the case.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Ronit Gabai
Reviews.Content: great quality, feels great to touch, very nice screen and fast processor.excellent quality for money. I believe is one of the best buys

Reviews.Title: Perfect tablet for casual use.
Reviews.Author: tumas
Reviews.Content: The device perfectly satisfies my requirements (reading work-related documents on train, having a portable device to keep me connected while traveling, listening to music - haven't tried using it for gaming etc.). Was especially impressed by the screen coating, which is fairly effective at reducing smudges.The microSD slot makes it more versatile than Google Nexus machines (if you need lots of space for your files), the interface is very responsive and battery life (no games) is upwards of 10 hours.In my opinion, the greatest drawback is a large number of useless apps that come pre-installed on the machine, but all of these can be removed easily. Also, the GPS signal reception is a bit tricky - not sure why, as the case is made of plastic (aluminium ones tend to inhibit the reception, plastic should fare much better).As I haven't really tried any high-performance games on it, it's hard to judge its performance record - however, apps like google maps are very fast.So if you need a practical device with a larger screen that would satisfy the demands of a casual user, I would highly recommend this little guy - especially given the price.

Reviews.Title: Good tablet, for a good price
Reviews.Author: K. E. Hawes
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a good "starter" tablet, without having to sink $500+ in to it, this one works fine! It's older, so it's not as powerful or "snappy", but it does everything I need. I gave it to my brother, so we could video chat, which this does quite well!

Reviews.Title: MyPad
Reviews.Author: DAN CLIFFORD "Dano"
Reviews.Content: Pretty nice tablet for the money.  I'm an android guy anyway...my wife has the iPad 2.  I think this compares very well overall for what I use it for.  Nice to have expandable memory.  You can buy 2 of these for around the price of an iPad.

Reviews.Title: Perfect tablet for price and surpisingly better than expected!
Reviews.Author: Donna M.
Reviews.Content: perfect tablet for the price.  great sound video quality and fast the tablet works without any glitchy issues  I am going get one for me!!

Reviews.Title: A gift for my wife
Reviews.Author: I_M_Pete "my_two_cents"
Reviews.Content: And she loves it!  It works well, looks good, holds a charge, does everything she needs. Nice electronics,  I honestly don't think the over-priced Apple I-Pads have anything on this machine.  (I have them at work and use them all the time.)  May have to get one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: BooksMusicGadgets "bjoot"
Reviews.Content: I have been using mine almost daily for nearly 6 months now:The full HD screen is great for watching movies and playing games.The processor is fast enough for any apps I've tried.Battery time is OK, but not great, some apps seems to eat a lot more than others.I have not used the camera much, but the few pictures i have taken look just fine.It is slightly on the heavy side.The price is great.  It cost much less than Samsung Galaxy tab 3, which only has 1200x800 screen.Value for price it is a clear 5-star product.

Reviews.Title: not the great tablet
Reviews.Author: IOAN RASINARIU
Reviews.Content: its not the great tablet on the market but its okay for a small kid to play games. .  .

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Denora Perez
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet.

Reviews.Title: everything is fine and run really smooth, but price is not lowest, tigerdirect has the best deal...
Reviews.Author: Lam Shan Kwok
Reviews.Content: Resolution is perfectly fine and run really smooth, but price is not lowest and tigerdirect has the best deal....alot cheaper

Reviews.Title: Almost Great
Reviews.Author: onefussyone
Reviews.Content: Good value for the $$, and probably a very good choice for someone not as fussy as me. A few issues caused me to return it. I think Clover Trail doesn't play as well with Android as it could. Great CS from Amazon on the return. They continue to impress me!

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THIS TABLET!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "BiloxiGal"
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd tablet I have owned in the last 6 months.  This is the one I am keeping.

Reviews.Title: Screen Easily Broken!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Fair warning...if you buy this tablet be extremely over protective of the screen as they are very easily broken and the repair cost is almost the same cost as the tablet itself.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy if you need Exchange Mail.  If you don't then this is a great tablet!
Reviews.Author: Lego League Coach
Reviews.Content: I tried every possible way under the sun to setup the exchange mail client with my two work mail systems and could not get it to work in any consistent way.  It almost starting working for my Lotus Notes gateway service but would not fully sync mail and other items. Conclusion is that the ActiveSync on board is not functional with anythin not specifically Microsoft Exchange although I have no such server to test with so it may fail there to.Great little tablet otherwise.  Super Fast and has some nice apps.  I know people get upset about bloatware with the ASUS tablet and I get that but some of the apps are quite nice.  I was really impressed with the basic function of the SuperNote app.Battery life is very good.The tablet is very lite and feels secure in your hands.  Button positions are intuitive and reasonably convenient.A great Bang for the buck!  I worked my tush off trying to get the exchange mail working because I really like this tablet.  Unfortunately it just wasn't meant to be and I cannot use a tablet that does not support my work email systems.

Reviews.Title: Works Intermittently
Reviews.Author: Steven Helprin
Reviews.Content: The first day or so it seemed to work well; very happy to have it. Now, when operating the unit it randomly goes to "snow" - just like in the old tube tv's when the channel was not tuned in. It simply fails to work. It's less than three months old. It is totally not dependable, and I am sorry that I bought this product for my wife for Christmas.

Reviews.Title: Great product!!!
Reviews.Author: Doug Marcum Jr. "dugathan"
Reviews.Content: Great tablet for the price.  Very lightweight & everything I was looking for!  Tablet is a lot faster than my old Touchpad.

Reviews.Title: Asus MeMO pad FHD 10
Reviews.Author: Melvin L. Thomposn
Reviews.Content: With 1920 resolution you cant go wrong Has a Dual Core processor and expandle up to 64 gig. Spend your money wisely buy one

Reviews.Title: Re-Review  -  Recieved Used/Refurbished - Payed for New
Reviews.Author: lsctt
Reviews.Content: ReReview - I received my replacement AsusMeMo tablet, on date, as promised. I dont have much experience with tablets. But I have to say, I think this one is great. It is fast, the display is great. Sound isn't great, but I have a bluetooth speaker system that overcomes that. And besides, who doesn't have that?  I have a cousin that bought a Samsung Galaxy 3 just before I bought my Asus. She paid more, and is jealous. I am unhappy that I was first sent a refab. But after all the reviews I had read about this Asus tab. I do believe that I made the best purchase. I must agree that there are far to many pre-installed apps that no real computer user needs. But I like that I can disable most all. A delete option would be better.First thought all was great, loved it. Did minimal setup, shut down and had hard time getting it to power up again. When it did, I found calander entries from someone else, from last year. They are replacing it with a word of mouth garrantee that I will receive a "brand new" one. Now it won't power on at all!! I would have payed a cheaper price if I wanted used. I payed for new and received used.It is a great tablet. Would have given it 5 stars. But receiving a broken used unit is not cool. 0 stars to Amazon. 2 Stars to Asus. And the person that helped me, could barely understand every other word she spoke.

Reviews.Title: Great when it works
Reviews.Author: Julian
Reviews.Content: Ive had the tablet for less than 3 weeks, and so far, while responsive and with decent battery life, it has started to auto-shut lown unoticedly the past week It will also randomly close down apps and the screen going black, becoming completely irresponsive, requiring a full reset by holding the on-off button for 15 seconds.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after 1 month
Reviews.Author: Alan S Langdon
Reviews.Content: After one month, the power button stopped working, so I couldn't put it to sleep mode. And once the battery ran out and it turned off, it never came back up again, even after fully charging the unit. Great disappointment for my first tablet, next time I guess I'll have to go Samsung or Apple.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: bought as a gift for in laws, they seem to really like it. no complaints, reliable ,good picture, seems good

Reviews.Title: Very good item
Reviews.Author: David Lesluyes
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I am very satisfied of my purchase.Very nice and bright screen.Tablet is very reactive and quality/price is excellent

Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet computer for a great price
Reviews.Author: W. D. Love
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet computer.  It has a bright, crisp display with a higher resolution than most of the others I considered buying, and the price was outstanding.  My primary purpose for buying it was to use it as an e-reader for viewing digital magazines, and it excels at that job.  I also use it for email, watching videos, and browsing the web.  Though I haven't measured it, the battery charge lasts much longer than other devices, such as a netbook, that I have used in the past.My only criticism is the sparsity of documentation.  The "user manual" that came with it provides little more than a physical description of the device, plus how to turn it on and charge the battery.  A downloadable manual that I found online contains that information plus rudimentary descriptions of a few of the apps.  This being my first Android device, I have struggled a bit trying to figure things out for myself.  Of course, not having a keyboard, this and similar tablets are not ideal for office automation tasks, but a Bluetooth keyboard and cover is available as an optional accessory.In summary, this tablet excels at the tasks for which it was designed and is an exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: I like it okay except for the power issues which is really a major thing I guess.
Reviews.Author: Shirley Mickelson
Reviews.Content: Most of the time I like it okay. I feel like it is maybe not as good of quality as I had hoped. I had to force start it with the paperclip in the little hole in the side after only a couple weeks. Today when I turned it on it was all blurry and weird and I thought I would have to do that again because it was not responding but finally cleared up and was normal after a couple of minutes. I had it on but in sleep mode when I went to bed the other night and it started turning on for a few seconds then turning off for a few seconds and just kept doing that so I had to turn it off completely to get it to stay off. It doesn't always charge when I plug it in. I think the charger doesn't always make a good connection. I doubt that I would have bought it if I would have known this about it before I got it. I feel like I maybe should return it but after putting all my personal info on it I hesitate to do that. I guess I could have someone show me how to clear all that but I just don't have much spare time to do all that.It's been 3 1/2 months now and am adding to my review. So after having this tablet for several months, I feel like I can't really rely on it working like it should. I was going to go on the internet last night and can't get the wifi to turn on. I turned it off and back on several times and it didn't seem to make any difference. I am wishing I would have spent a little more and got an ipad or something. My daughter-in-law has one of those and she has never had the trouble I have with mine. Her little kids use hers all the time. Sometimes I really have to work at it to get it to turn on.

Reviews.Title: Nice Tablet
Reviews.Author: Three-D
Reviews.Content: Originally bought the Kindle HD 8.9. Returned it immediately because it was too App limited. The MeMo is as good or better hardware and is open to Play Store. NICE screen. Fast & Light. About the same price as a Kindle HD 8.9

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: Wendell McQuary
Reviews.Content: I had the Asus tf300 but an unfortunate drop put an end to that tablet. I had been having some problems with that pad so I was a little apprehensive about buying another Asus.  The other reviews plus the discounted price made me pull that trigger and give the Memo fhd 10 a try.  The graphics are great and the processing speed is faster than my previous tablet.  This is a pleasant surprise. For everyday use this is the perfect machine. Plus, it has the same charger as my cellphone unlike my previous Asus that used a proprietary one.  I highly recommend it especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Joanna Szajer
Reviews.Content: It was a great tablet - unfortunately the touch screen cracked and it doesn't work anymore. I would recommend insurance.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the money-but Amazon-Fix your shipping!
Reviews.Author: T. Westphal
Reviews.Content: Not a bad complaint to be made about this tablet. I tried 2 others and the HD screen on this one was much better than the other 2 tablets I looked at.My complaint is Amazon's free shipping! My package sat in a post office 50 miles away for 1 week! Unbelievable! If you can't do any better than that start charging me for shipping again.........

Reviews.Title: It is good but could be better...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "TVR"
Reviews.Content: Had been using an iPad , had a Windows 8 touchscreen laptop and wanted an android tablet. The tablet is good except that I see a few glitches popping up. Sometimes it freezes up for no apparent reason and has to be restarted. I got a scrambled screen yesterday, don't know why...  It keeps saying that the DMclient has stopped responding and I don't know what that means... Certain apps won't load properly> this May be the fault of the apps though. However, when it works properly it works nicely, responds well and fast, screen resolution and colours are great, sound is good.One thing I hate is the App Store for android,  having come from using the Apple ecosystem I can honestly say that Google play store is nothing compared to Apple when it comes to the apps store. I wished they had more and better apps especially games apps and more variety of top of the line apps like Apple does.

Reviews.Title: ASUS MEMO PAD FHD 10 ME302C-B1-BL 10.1-INCH 32 GB TABLET (BLUE)
Reviews.Author: reliakakiko
Reviews.Content: THIS TABLET MADE MY WIFE BUSY WHENEVER SHE HAS TIME TO SIT IN.  I AM HAPPY THAT I GIFTED HER THIS ITEM AND SHE IS ENJOYING IT, THOUGH, SHE IS NEWBIE TO TABLET BUT NOT ON LAPTOP.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Jerry K. Schwehm "Fig Street Studio"
Reviews.Content: Had this a month now. Working well. Camera is great. It does discharge rapidly so you need to conserve battery with an app you like. Top off the charge a lot. Functions well for my personal use and small business I need to e-mail a lot. Do not let it get below 30% charge as it will shut down until a good charge is done. Love the many apps available. Plenty of storage for my needs. I added a 16 gb micro card and have never had to use it. The internal storage is plenty. I use cloud storage apps for most storage needs, doc, pictures, music so the micro card is not needed much. Very good picture resolution as I watch movies on it. Sound is basic, added an external speaker to try to help out.

Reviews.Title: so far so good!!
Reviews.Author: Esteban
Reviews.Content: Im just getting used to it and learning to use it but I definetely like it. Its fast, has a beautiful screen, and the interface is great

Reviews.Title: Dead after 1.5 months
Reviews.Author: Alex Ho
Reviews.Content: Received mid-November, and died a few days ago. Was working very well up until that point. It all happened suddenly - all of a sudden, apps started crashing, forcing me to do a couple of forced restarts. After a couple of iterations, it now refuses to start at all.

Reviews.Title: i like it
Reviews.Author: timothy morrison
Reviews.Content: i love the tablet but i dont like that some of the apps dont work on it like for example movie tube dont work that was the biggest reason for buying this device i was looking at others but choose this one because that i figured it would work on it. Other wise good device!! I would have give it a 40 star if it can play movie tube (APP)

Reviews.Title: eReader Plus
Reviews.Author: R. Eyster
Reviews.Content: I got it to replace my Bible ... it weighs less.  I have several versions, plus references downloaded.  All available for use without all the weight!  Now, all the pluses.  Music on the go, eMail, surfing, IP Phone when connected.  Display of photos is great.  The screen resolution of 1920 x 1200 is full HD and GREAT!  Still learning the Android OS.  WiFi works without drops throughout my house.

Reviews.Title: Do not Buy the 10" Asus Memopad FHD if you want the Asus Transcover for it
Reviews.Author: Navigator
Reviews.Content: The Asus Transcover was announced by Asus when the 10" MemoPad was announced.  To date it is available in many other countries in Europe and Asia.  It is not for sale in the USA and despite many calls, I have not been able to get any information from Asus regarding when or if it will be available.  Regarding this, their customer relations have been very poor.

Reviews.Title: Don' t wait for Nexus...this ASUS Memo 10 Full HD (FHD) is great!
Reviews.Author: N2
Reviews.Content: Great for gaming. Try Real Racing 3 it will convince you. Full HD screen. Intel processor is dual core hyper-threading 4 threads... quite fast. Ignore some benchmarks for ARM and just try this smooth tablet. Light for a 10 inch tab(580g).Back is some kind of grippy plastic that just works. Funny that the same people who want metal backs seam to worry about finger prints. This one is fingerprint free and feels very good. I find that it makes for a great movie tablet and gaming and runs Flipboard reader very smoothly. A variant of this could easily be the next NEXUS 10... BTW I picked up LG G2 phone recently and now the NEXUS 5 comes out based on the G2 but downspeced in screen memory options and battery size. I find the 5.2" LG G2 and this 10 MEMO to be the perfect options for mobile and home use.-CheersP.S. Checked my tablet and a 64GB microSDXCUHS-I from Sony works perfectly!

Reviews.Title: Different Than the iPad
Reviews.Author: Diane B. Wilkes "Diane Wilkes, Voracious Reader"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this to see if it would be suitable for my mom, and realized it wouldn't work for her because it is too large and heavy compared to the mini iPad or even the regular-sized one. It is slower to boot up and there are some differences that, for me, involved a small but real learning curve.The  most important thing for me is weight; I am not buff and I frequently travel by public transportation. However, if a person is looking for a tablet at a great price, they could do far worse than the ASUS MeMo Pad. Its very large screen (for a tablet) is ideal for video watching, it offers plenty of bells and whistles and did I mention the price point makes it stand out?

Reviews.Title: AMAZEBALLS
Reviews.Author: Jerica Crawford
Reviews.Content: WIFE LOVES THIS THING!!!!now shes off my back and leaves me alone to my own demise. now i can just sit there on my ass all lazy and ingore my kids!XXXYOLOSWAGBBQXXX

Reviews.Title: Kind of love it.
Reviews.Author: Hongwei Ge
Reviews.Content: The best choice for its price.Deliver so fast.Easy to use.The only worse thing to me is that The Table felled to ground when I fall asleep. So the tablet‘s left-upper corner was broken just two days after I got it. Kind of silly for me. I don't know what to do.

Reviews.Title: Really a review of the Android experience.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is my second tablet - got it because I fell in love with my 7" Samsung (purchased as a reader), and wanted something bigger to get the full internet experience.  Between the two devices, I've spent a solid week buried in Android, trying to wrap my Windows mind around it, so I'm really comparing the tablet to a windows desktop.Pros first: Portability!  I can read and type comfortably on my lap in front of the fire.  The navigation is simple and intuitive, and on the whole it seems to be a more streamlined experience.  The hardware works and everything was easy to dive into right out of the box.Cons: The touch screen is driving me crazy.  The internet is all about chasing links, and I'm used to the crisp accurate click of a mouse on that little hand.  It's not always easy to FIND the links on a touch screen, and finding the right stylus and right technique shouldn't be so hard.  I'm really tired of shooting off to locations unplanned (No back button!)  I think the random zooming in and out is the worst.OK, as I said, more of a comment on the Android experience than the Asus tablet.  I think I like the tablet just fine.  The display is amazing, too.Update: I meant no "forward" button, not back.  However, there are other ways to find old pages using some clever buttons that I'm still discovering.

Reviews.Title: Issue with the Battery Indicator
Reviews.Author: Emad Alhajlah
Reviews.Content: I got issue with the tablet after less than one week since i start used it,The Battery Indicator is Stuck all the Time Full until the tablet turn off cuz no more battery,When i plugged in the charger For 10 seconds the battery is Full 100%,its never showing me the percentage from 1-99, only 100% showing to me...i was pleasured until this issue...

Reviews.Title: It is a good product.
Reviews.Author: Taylor Twogood
Reviews.Content: It is what I expected of a tablet for the price I paided. it runs well although some times it is slow on downloads but that is to be expected for all tablets I believe. yes I would recommend this product to anyone that is looking for a above average Tablet.

Reviews.Title: Asus MeMO Pad
Reviews.Author: Stan G.
Reviews.Content: The quality of this tablet was below par for what I was expecting.  Screen resolution was poor, sound quality of the speakers was bad.  Ended up returning it after 2 weeks.  It might be okay for some, but not for me.

Reviews.Title: Connectivity Problem and Asus Service
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: ASUS MeMO Pad FHD 10 ME302C-A1-BL 10.1-Inch 16GB TabletBought it December 2nd 2013.Background: From the beginning I was surprised how much slower its internet speed was in comparison with the Kindle FireHD (Asus ~ 10Mbps / Kindle ~ 18Mbps) tested side by side. Asus also showed a little blip in the wireless icon on top of the screen, but I assumed it just indicated traffic.Today: I got constant network/communication errors - Kindle no problem. Spend 5 hours resetting all my network stuff just to make sure. Same problem.  Called Asus (hard to find tel #, but no long wait). First tech did various diagnostics, then recommended a factory reset to “solve” the problem. Did it, and it showed full connection to my WiFi (excellent strength) but attempt to connect to my Google account timed out with the same communication errors. Did 2 more factory resets without success.  Called Asus back, and was given RMA to send in. No indication how long it will take, shipping at my expense (actually suggested to contact Amazon to see if they would replace the item since it had been purchased such a short time ago!!).Summary: Very unhappy, don’t buy  Asus, or get it from Costco - they have a 90 day return.

Reviews.Title: not what i thought it would be
Reviews.Author: Jeremy olmeda
Reviews.Content: its an ok tablet, it doesnt play flash player which was a major downfall ( cant stream live video) the user feature sucks because only the owner user can access the sd card everyone else has to use the internal storage. The tablet is extremely fragile my 2 year old dropped it and now the touch screen goes crazy one in a while and when scrolling up and down it clicks whatever is in the screen very annoying other then that is a so-so tablet for the price

Reviews.Title: it's perfect if !
Reviews.Author: Hoang "hqt0705"
Reviews.Content: it's perfect if Asus also delivers an european connector or gives the client the chance to choice! I come from Germanyand must buy an extra connector!

Reviews.Title: That disappointment did not receive what you buy
Reviews.Author: Juan Carlos Peña
Reviews.Content: Disappointment that what I got was not what you buy ... I get a smaller tablet with 10gb memory when I was applying for 16gb ... please reply in this regard need gentlemen ..Lords of amazon is the first time something like this happens to me and I have always received the product on time and on quality but on this occasion did not fulfill my expectations or requirements that I acquired For this purchase I need please give solution in this regard. I feel upset hope your answers thank you very much, I do not even arrived accessories

Reviews.Title: everything works except the camera/camera apps
Reviews.Author: lol
Reviews.Content: The camera/camera apps does not work.  I have been spending a lot of time investigating and re-installing the apps.Unfortunately, I didn't find out this within my grace period of returning the product.Asus should have tested every single tablet before shipping to the merchant.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: oneluv
Reviews.Content: I received the tablet as scheduled, the only thing is I ordered blue, but received black.. Its my first tablet and I'm loving it...almost as much as my laptop.I would recommend the tablet to anyone. Its most convenient when traveling.

Reviews.Title: no amazon prime
Reviews.Author: Ross W. Young
Reviews.Content: I can't get amazon prime downloaded on this unit so no movies or download rentals I've tried everything suggested from amazon

Reviews.Title: Great tablet, horrible screen.
Reviews.Author: Destiny Thornton "Stimpster"
Reviews.Content: First of all, I think the tablet is pretty freaking awesome. It's fast, sleek, and easy to use. However, I set the tablet down GENTLY and picked it up about five minutes later to find a crack all the way across the screen. I called customer service and they gave me the response of the tablet not being covered under warranty if the screen cracks. They used the term "abuse". I have never "abused" the tablet in any way. I usually hate Walmart, but we bought a service agreement when we returned the first MeMo tablet due to dead pixels in the middle of the screen. I sent the tablet in to the Walmart Product Assist (they even paid the shipping), and they stated that they could not fix it. They sent me an e-gift card for the price we paid for the tablet. I went ahead and got another MeMo pad with another warranty because I loved the tablet so much. At least I have two years worth of protection since this tablet's screen is apparently made out of butter. I will definitely look at other tablets if the screen cracks on this one. I was going to get my son an Asus laptop for when he goes to college, but I think I will look for something more durable.

Reviews.Title: no thanks
Reviews.Author: Jacob Haddad
Reviews.Content: I am usually happy with Asus, however I am disappointed with this product, so far it has been quite jumpy.  The software that comes preloaded is annoying and overall I guess you get what you pay for with this tablet

Reviews.Title: Stay away.
Reviews.Author: Eric Wright
Reviews.Content: Good while it lasts, but once you have a broken part...Finding replacement touchscreens(the "glass" part) is not an option for this model.  Contact asus and they will tell you to send it to them and expect to pay 200 for the fix.  Local shops arent allowed to purchase the screen for it thus they cant even work on it.  The bottom line is dont buy this tablet, maybe stay away from asus tabs in general as it seems they are hard to find parts for.Very displeased with customer support as well.

Reviews.Title: lack of flash was such a disappointment!
Reviews.Author: timea
Reviews.Content: I was very excited about this tablet and waa planning to get a lot of work done on it but it turned out to be such a disappointment as I found out that these tablets no longer run flash and therefore every program I needed that required flash player simply doesnt open. And theres no way around it either. All the purpose of my purchase was lost. I admit the tablet producers can do little to bring back Adobe to releasing flash back to the consumers, but we should at least be warned. By the time I realized I cannot log on to the sites I need for work,  It was too late and already threw away the packaging so now its just sitting on my desk gathering dust..

Reviews.Title: misrepresentation of products
Reviews.Author: artis wilkins
Reviews.Content: The reason for the rating is the color stated in description was "blue" but i received " black" instead with no explanation. Performs adequately but would be hesitant to order again if color is substituted without getting approval from customer.  Also, i was mislead to beleive that the folio keyboard listed as an accessory would work with the memo pad model ME302c.  It does not and will only work with the me301 series.  Very disappointed because one of the reasons i chose this brand was because of the keyboard case being thin and sleek.  Not sure yet if i will keep this tablet.

Reviews.Title: HBO GO, WatchESPN etc. Do Not Function
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "paul_brendan_meehan"
Reviews.Content: It's possible I just happened to receive a lemon, but despite having a perfectly valid FiOS account, two of the apps I was looking forward to using the most - HBO Go and WatchESPN - don't work at all on this tablet. ASUS support had nothing to offer. Sending it back and trying another brand.

Reviews.Title: overall nice tablet
Reviews.Author: CatFan "catfan"
Reviews.Content: I have owned about twelve or thirteen tablets so far within the last five years or so. I currently have for tablets and two laptops and an all in one home PC.  My other three tablets are all quad core, because I like playing games and multi tasking.  Overall the tablet works really well, but it doors have a few issues. It does stutter quite a bit and has locked up quite a few times on me and have had to do a hard reboot.  I have had issues with the battery too, sometimes the battery level locks up and it doesn't display the correct battery level. Sometimes it even shuts off without any low battery notice at all. I am very slipped when it comes to tablets so I have tried just about everything. Plus battery seems to run down extremely fast.  There have been about six times that it has completely shut down on me and froze solid, nothing worked until hard reboot, one time I couldn't even get it to hard reboot so I let battery ruin down then after charge it worked fine again.  But I use this tablet adopt eight hours a day so it does get spot of use. 90% of the time it works great.

Reviews.Title: Device ran once and then died
Reviews.Author: Jaspreet Singh
Reviews.Content: I played around with it for a bit. It ran a couple of hours very nicely. Seemed great value for money.But then I put it to charge and it died to never wake up. I let it charge for a few days but nothing happened and I had to return it.

Reviews.Title: Specs are more than a little misleading
Reviews.Author: p putkowski
Reviews.Content: The Z2560 processor runs at 930MHz. 1600MHz is it's "turbo" mode. It's a shame they did not use a more powerful chip.

Reviews.Title: This product is crap
Reviews.Author: Nicholas  Carrera
Reviews.Content: Why?Every time I use it, it hangs and I have to reset the tablet.This is annoying for a product that is supposed to be quality ...Too bad ASUS, should improve the compatibility of your hardware with android: (

Reviews.Title: Screen is too shinny to even read,hard to get it to turn on, and it's not as fast as a iPad 4 with half as much ram
Reviews.Author: Gregory J. Oneal "Grego"
Reviews.Content: Kind of disappointed in it over all, I have several Asus products and that's what steered me to this one, but overall I wish now I would have bought the iPad.

Reviews.Title: Terrible software
Reviews.Author: Hewbie PDX
Reviews.Content: I returned it immediately after it was delivered because when you add an email account, the CPU utilization goes from about 5% to over 50%, so it effectively has only a 800 Mhz CPU.  If ASUS can fix the email software, it would be a great value.

Reviews.Title: Be realistic when purchasing a tablet at this price point.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a budget tablet, plain and simple. Here are a couple of points to illustrate why I say that.1. The screen resolution is pretty good but that is overshadowed by the dimness of the screen. On it's highest brightness setting, it isn't very bright at all.2. The Intel processor is a bit too glitchy for me. And there are issues with apps not being compatible with it. Apps are slow to load, the tablet is slow to wake up and switch screens.3. The Wi-Fi can be pretty frustrating. While trying to watch Netflix it takes quite some time to buffer to HD, the picture gets pixelated at times even after buffering.  I did a side by side comparison using my Galaxy note 2 cellphone using Wi-Fi and the Asus simply can't keep up.4. The battery life is pretty abysmal. Asus advertises "Up to 10 hours* of battery life (* looping 720p video under test conditions)".Tonight I began watching Netflix with a 100% charge. After only 3.5 hours of use I was all the way down to 9%. That is a far cry from "up to 10 hours".At this point, I am finished with this product. I am not really interested in finding out what other ways it can disappoint me. I did the factory reset, tossed it back in the box and am returning it tomorrow morning. I figured I would give it a shot, knowing that if I was unhappy with it that I could return it hassle free thanks to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: SO frusterating!
Reviews.Author: Robin
Reviews.Content: I hate mine, I am going to sell it!  Just about every app I have it crashes, or takes forever to play it.  If you are just cruising the internet or watching a movie it's fine but if you are like me a want to play games good luck!  I have had to uninstall about 7 games because they do not work.  Save your money and buy a different one, not with the Intel processor.

Reviews.Title: Unhappy Tablet Owner
Reviews.Author: Randy Cook "meupinatree"
Reviews.Content: I am very displeased. when the tablet is in sleep mode, it will repeatedly start up and then shut down on it's own.  In addition, when I turn the tablet off and then turn it back on, the screen is fussy and can't be used.

Reviews.Title: It's OK
Reviews.Author: S. Appleton
Reviews.Content: Have had this for about a week and have to say I'm less than impressed with this tablet. Not sure if it's the Intel Atom SoC or what but compared to the 7" Hisense Sero 7 Pro Tegra 3 powered tablet (basically a clone of the 2012 Nexus 7) I have, this is slower, sluggish web surfing and the wifi itself seems to have connectivity issues.Display is sharp, sound is OK for a tablet w/rear facing speakers.Loaded with a lot of Asus bloatware.If the guys on XDA Developers come up with a root for it and a custom ROM is developed for it, maybe it'll perform better. Unfortunately I'll probably be returning it before that happens.UPDATE 11-10-2103 : I have returned the FHD 10 for a refund. Am trying the Asus Transformer Book T100 Windows 8.1 instead.Sam

Reviews.Title: Will not connect to wifi
Reviews.Author: Vicki
Reviews.Content: I did a good amount of research prior to purchasing this tablet as a Christmas gift for my husband.  Unfortunately, it is being returned, as it will not connect to wifi.  We tried in various locations, and all other electronics would connect, but not this one.  Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: No Java
Reviews.Author: Raenell
Reviews.Content: I had to return this tablet because I needed if for business and I could not down load Java. I am looking for a windows based tablet that will support Java.Raenell Hill

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it
Reviews.Author: sunflower
Reviews.Content: If I could put worse I would. The best thing about this product is that when it breaks they are really nice and you can send it in as many times as you want. So as long as you don't mind a worthless tablet then get this one and enjoy your conversations with ASUS.

Reviews.Title: Deal Killer: The One Big Flaw and Why I Won't Buy This Tablet [UPDATE: I Bought One]
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I'm currently shopping for a new tablet to replace my iPad 1st generation. I'm not an Apple fanboi so I've been looking at Androids too. I bought my tablet used from a friend a couple of years ago. Apple's latest iOS update has pretty much killed the 1st gen pads. Apps crash constantly, browsing is crappy, etc. So, I'm looking for something else and something affordable.Today I looked at the ASUS MeMO Pad FHD 10 at a local brick & mortar store. I played with it for a long time. It's everything all the positive reviews said for the most part. However, there is one HUGE thing that killed the deal for me:The "Home" button is in the center bottom of the screen when in horizontal mode. This means that if you're holding the tablet in your hands your thumb can't reach the home button like you can on an iPad. You have to let go of one side of the tablet to hit the button.iPads have the home button on the short side of the tablet so when you're holding it horizontally (which I normally do) your thumb can easily reach it to turn off apps. I've become used to that.I'm really disappointed as I was ready to buy this tablet. I really didn't want to buy another iPad, as they're so expensive. I may have to settle for a used one or a 2nd or 3rd gen model.[EDIT] Okay, perhaps I was a bit harsh with only two stars. I upped it to three. Everything BUT the home button is really nice. Especially the price. Just so people don't think I'm an Apple fanboi trolling Asus reviews (I've got better things to do with my time actually), I own a Motorola Droid Razr M Android phone. I've never owned an iPhone. I've owned Windows computers ever since v3.1. My kids gave me an iPod for Christmas one year, though. My personal view is Apple products are overpriced.It's all what you get used to. I'm used to having the home button right at my fingertip (or thumb, actually).[UPDATE 04 December 2013]Well, I ended up buying this tablet. The only other 10 inch tablet I could find with a Home button not in the center was a Galaxy Tab 2. That button is on the left/bottom and would be sufficient but I learned that the Android version it runs is older and newer updates place the Home button in the center. So, I went ahead and bought the ASUS.I have changed my rating to 5 stars to reflect how impressed I am with this tablet after playing with it for a few days.It is taking me awhile to get used to the Home button placement but it's not as big a deal as I had feared. I'm impressed with the speed of the tablet, the clarity of the screen, among other things.Lesson learned: Never say never. :-)

Reviews.Title: biggest mistake ever !!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Theo
Reviews.Content: ProsDurableLarge memoryConsDisorginized systemMost apps are always buggyAndroid suxCamera res is crapWord processor is rediculous does not even have spell check

Reviews.Title: Not what I was looking For but a great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Robert T Church
Reviews.Content: This Tablet was too hard for me to use.  Looking for a different 10" Tablet. I'll know when I find the right 10" but I may need some assistance. I will say that the Nerds were quick on sending me the product and it arrived as ordered but I elected to return it.I recommend the Nerds as they are good to work with as a company I give them 5 stars. It was just not the tablet I was looking for

Reviews.Title: Not 5 MP camera
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: False advertisingIt said it has a 5MP camera but when I checked the setting it has 1.6 MP in rear and 1 MP in front.no wonder the picture quality if so crappy. I mean who uses 1MP camera these days.Maybe it's not Amazon's fault I will contact Asus..Again, false advertising

Reviews.Content: It is the wrong color and there was no shipping invoice to allow me to return and exchange it.  I have all ready ordered another one in the right color.  Now I am stuck with an item I do not like.
